results.description:
This meet-up is for out of the box thinkers, doers and makers interested in dialogue about transforming how we lead to ensure the sustainability of the global commons and the common good.  Using technology and policy as two key drivers we will exchange information and about products, events, books etc.  that are helping to shape the Future.
No sector is off limits .. from the future of water to the future of law to the future of education to the future of shopping.  We will meet monthly in downtown DC or downtown Silver Spring.

results.description: This group is for anyone who wants make the most of their digital photography. All skills levels are welcome. Get hands-on experience and learn how to use your digital camera to get the results you want. The workshops can covers camera basic, understanding the menus and white balance. Walking tours of Annapolis and Longwood Gardens are on our do list. We also can cover design and composition or we can also explore post processing of images and demonstrate Lightroom 5 and Photoshop. Let's get together and discuss areas of interest. We will meet at Roger Miller's studio on Hollins St.

topics.name: PTSD, Disability and Women Veteran Issues

results.description: Vets Journey Home is an organization dedicated to helping Veterans with emotional issues from time in military service. Vets Journey Home focuses on PTS, MST (Military Sexual Trauma), emotional guilt and trauma many Veterans carry with them long after their time in service. These are feelings that are hard to release to family and friends who have not experienced them. Vets Journey Home is committed to giving Veterans the Welcome Home they deserved and helping them heal their hearts and bring peace to their souls.
results.name: Vets Journey Home Maryland

results.description: We write because we love to. The people in our group are those who try to write every day. We want to get published and we share leads, ideas, and books. Mostly we want to write better, so we share readings, including our own writing, and we work on our skills using guidelines and exercises from writing manuals.

Nos encanta salir pero la mayoría de las veces salimos con gente soltera o solos, ya que toda nuestra familia está lejos. Este MeetUp es para Hispan@s que están casados o tienen pareja estable. Formar amistades de parejas que puedan perdurar en esta ciudad tan atareada y divertirnos a lo grande como en nuestros paises!!!

results.description:
This group is for Women in Business who are looking for a way to grow both professionally and personally. We support each other and are building a network that gives guidance, support, and resources to our sister business owners.   We will attend events together, hold monthly Meet and Greet events, attend our sister group member events, provide educational opportunities as well as social activities that build relationships.  Several times a year we will partner with Non-profit organizations and others that support women on a variety of levels; this includes opportunities to volunteer. As such we are also looking for ways to encourage young girls to become entrepreneurs.  If this sounds like something you want to be a part of then you are welcome to join us.  

If you do, you will be asked to attend a minimum of 6 events per year and volunteer with us at least once a year.  This is the only way to build a solid network and true friendships.  Those that continually RSVP to MeetUps and do not attend will be deleted from the group.  Those that join our Meetup group but do not attend within 2 months of joining will be deleted.  There is no fee for membership, however, some Meetups may require payment.  As out group grows so does the fee for hosting the Meetup group so we may from time to time limit the members to keep cost down and open up membership as needed.

Please note that many members of this Meetup may be in Direct Sells.  There is no recruiting allowed! Should this possibly change you will be notified.  This is banned to make sure members are not feeling pressured to join organizations are constantly being bombarded with products and recruiting promotions.   If someone is interested in joining your organization please meet with them outside of our activities.  

Have an upcoming event or promotion and you want us to support it, please message me and request I post it on our calendar.  However, you must be an ACTIVE member to get this perk.. Active is defined as attending the minimum amount of events and volunteering.

Questions? Message me!  I look forward to meeting each of you and making new business connections.
results.name: Women in Business Fellowship of the DMV

results.description: This group aims toward uniting Haitian WOMEN and Men in the DMV interested in connecting, networking, volunteering, and learning more about the Haitian culture through different events such as after work happy hour, dining out, bowling, workshops, fundraisers, seminars. With an open mind, friendship and an uplifting message; promises to be an avenue for you to start or continue your life's journey.
results.name: Haitian Women & Men In The Dmv

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in becoming wealthy. We focus on helping members to meet their professional goals by showing them the steps involved in making, saving, and accumulating wealth. Our Meetups will include conferences; seminars and workshops; contracting events and meetings; business award ceremonies; business luncheons; webinars and more.
results.name: DMV Professional Wealth Builders

results.description:
What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.

Sign up to our Couchbase Developer Newsletter
results.name: Couchbase MD, VA, DC

results.description: This group is meant to serve as a forum to bring expecting, new and veteran moms together who want to stay and get in shape. Events, classes, boot camps, etc can be posted to this group to bring us all together to keep each other accountable and motivated. In the nicer weather months we can meet up for walk/runs at the many parks in Howard County, and in the cooler weather months find some fun prenatal and post natal exercise classes! I look forward to having you all a part of the group!

results.description:
I am thrilled to be taking over Annapolis Brew Crew from Courtney (see below).  Without all of her hard work to get this group up and running, I wouldn’t have had the opportunity to step in for her when her work got too busy.

I’m going to start this off slowly as I get my organizer feet under me.  Initially, I’ll schedule a number of happy hours to get more acquainted with you, the members.  Beer festivals and brewery tours will be added shortly after.

I hope, that with your participation, we can make this a fun and possibly even an educational meetup group.  Welcome, fellow ABCers!

- Gregg <br>

<br>

More About this Meetup

From the original organizer, Courtney:

This is a group for fun people in the Annapolis area who appreciate craft beer. We'll gather at establishments featuring great beer lists, go on local brewery tours and maybe even catch a beer festival or two.

I started this group because I genuinely enjoy a tasty craft beer and I want to seek out where to get the best brews in the Annapolis vicinity while making new friends.

All levels of craft beer enthusiasts are welcome but beer snobs are not! You don't have to memorize fancy beer lingo, know if "Shake Your Money Maker" is a song or a beer or be able to sing "99 Bottles of Beer" in tune. But, you do have to be 21 and mind your Ps and Qs. 

A few notes about this meetup group are below.  Any questions or comments you have about this group are always welcome.  Thank you for taking the time to check out Annapolis Brew Crew. Cheers, Courtney

Genesis of Annapolis Brew Crew:  Annapolis Brew Crew is version 2.0 of a “Brew Crew” group I had in San Diego.  As San Diego is one of the hottest spots in the country for craft beer, there were about 20 breweries, including big ones like Stone, within about seven miles of where I lived and worked.  The intent of my San Diego Brew Crew was to visit a new brewery the first Thursday of each month after work.  Overtime, people wanted to join my crew but didn’t like beer so we often deviated from the breweries and went to local bars that had spirits and wine.  Basically, Brew Crew evolved into a happy hour group.  Now that I have moved cross country, I am starting a new Brew Crew but do plan to keep this one focused on beer. 

Limited Membership: Initially, Annapolis Brew Crew will be limited to 50 members but should this group continue to flourish, I will pay additional dues to Meetup.com to expand our membership base.  The reason for this is simply because Meetup has gotten expensive and charges the organizer based on the number of members it has.  I don’t mind paying for additional members as long as they are actively engaged in Annapolis Brew Crew so I will monitor this situation closely as our meetup group matures.  Members who have not recently been active on the Annapolis Brew Crew site may be removed; however, if you are still interested in this Meetup, please feel free to rejoin as we’d love to see you at a future event.
results.name: Annapolis Brew Crew

topics.name: Learn to Dance West Coast Swing

results.description:
Are you a West Coast Swing Dancer?  Never tried West Coast Swing but always wanted to?  Do you love dancing in general?  Find yourself watching Dancing with the Stars and thought to yourself I want to try that?

Looking for something fun to do on a Saturday night and wish you could meet new and friendly people to hang out with in the process? Perhaps your looking for a fun way to get and/or stay in shape?  

If any of those sound like you, you have come to the right place!  Every 3rd Saturday Erica Smith will teach a West Coast Swing Lesson from 8-9.  From 9 - 1 am dance the night away to your favorite jams with our Guest DJ.

There will be snacks, great music and a friendly/welcoming crowd.  We're all ages, multicultural and diverse.  Everyone is welcome as long as you're nice!  To us, there are no strangers -- only friends we haven't yet met.   Best of all, no partner or dance experience is required! Just a willingness to learn and a fun friendly attitude :)
results.name: West Coast Swing Lessons and Dance Party

For more Info- amsalsadance@gmail.com

http://www.facebook.com/amsalsadance

results.description: Our club is involved in serving the Howard County, Maryland community, especially families, individuals, and organizations who need a helping hand.  Our motto is  "Service Above Self."   Our members include men and women who share that commitment and enjoy each others fellowship.  We invite speakers to our weekly meetings who enable us to learn more about the community where we live and about ways we can be of service.

results.description: The Bowie-Crofton Camera Club has been serving photography enthusiast for over thirty years. In addition to Bowie and Crofton, our members come from a large geographical area that covers much of central and southern Maryland. The membership of B-CCC demonstrates a wide range of skill levels, interests and experiences. Each year's schedule features guests who cover topics that are educational and entertaining for everyone from the newest, most novice photographer on up to the seasoned professional. Our members range from beginners to highly skilled photographers. Our interests are digital imaging, black & white prints, color prints, and slide shows, with many devotees in each division. You will find this an active club - we do things. We meet four Monday evenings each month, September through May, for competitions, lectures, demonstrations and discussions. We conduct workshops, go on fun-filled field trips and publish an informative, award-winning newsletter.
results.name: Bowie-Crofton Camera Club

results.description:
In modern popular usage, an epicurean is a connoisseur of the arts of life and the refinements of sensual and sexual pleasures ; epicureanism implies a love or knowledgeable enjoyment, especially of good food and drink. Because Epicureanism posits that pleasure is the ultimate good (telos), it has been commonly accepted since ancient times as a doctrine that advocates the partaking in pleasures such as intimate contact and interaction of the sexes, sexual pleasure and the pursuit of the finest in culinary dining. This group is for people that want to bring discussions of sexuality out of the shadows. Only limited by your desires to meet like minded people to talk, share knowledge, experiences and explore topics typically kept in whispers.  It is for like minded individuals who desire the pursuit of sensual and sexual pleasure, especially to the enjoyment of good food and sexual comfort in a non-judgmental, safe environment.  We will have ample opportunity at the meetups to indulge in both.

That being said, due to the growth of the meetup, we have  limited  single male membership in the group. Naturally, those who are now current members will remain on the rolls, any new applicant will be placed on a waiting list until such time as the gender gap becomes more balanced; which may occur at any time. This group was designed originally to be a small group with small, intimate meetups, open to a balanced ratio of male female members with varying sexual preferences for friendly, fun-loving, adventurous, open-minded, sensual, and sexual experiences in the Baltimore / DC area.  We have found that due to many people signing up who are not serious about meeting, ONLY PEOPLE WILLING AND ABLE TO MEET INDIVIDUALLY WITH THE ORGANIZERS FOR INITIAL COFFEE/CONVERSATION/ETC...WILL BE PERMITTED INTO THE GROUP. We are not models; we are real people. At the same time, we are attractive, fun, and open-minded.  Fun couples and single women with the right attitude are especially very welcome.  Women in the group are generally bi-sexual, but it is not necessary that you are.   If you have read all this and still think you are right for the group and the group is right for you, then join today.  we welcome you to the world of Epicurean pleasure ............................
results.name: Northeastern  Epicurean Sensuality Meetup

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to support the growth of the Baltimore console fighting game community. Gamers of all levels, backgrounds, and various competitive videogames are most welcome.

The end goal of this group is to support the local businesses that support the console fighting game community, build friendships, share ideas to improve the group gathering experiences, and have a very fun time.

We look forward to meeting and gaming with you soon.

results.description:
We are a group of 20's-early 40's that enjoy to get together for trivia, happy hour, live music, good food and an occasional bar crawl.  Also we have a long list of out door activities including corn hole, bbq, hiking, camping, canoeing, running.

We have a good base of friends in the Annapolis area and are always open to meeting new members, so feel free to come out and meet everyone.  Suggestions for events are also encouraged.

This group is open to anyone, for that reason we will need to have a personal conduct policy.  Please  respect your fellow meetup members.  In past groups it has been a rare occurrence that this would need to be implemented.  If anyone has an issue with another member please bring it to the attention of any organizer.  As organizers of this group we promise to keep all communications private.  In the event of an issue, the member will be informed and if repeated incidents occur they will be removed from the group.
results.name: Annapolis Socials (20's-30's)

topics.name: Make New Friends, from all Walks of Life
Come Eat, Drink, Dance and Socialize

results.description:
Bored??? Tired of the same old stuff??? What something new in your life???

Well, look no further! Things To Do in the DMV Area: Fun & New Experiences For People from all walks of life. We're two premiere event planning organization for socializing and networking with fellow new and old friends.

Our group is focused on showing you all of what DMV area has to offer. It's a opportunity to meet new friends, network with professionals, and explore new adventures. We are a social group comprised of singles, couples, parents , all ages, shapes, sizes, colors and creeds.

Members of our group are friendly and approachable. NO MORE seeing and doing things alone. When you attend one of our events, you'll be greeted with a smile and we will introduce you to like minded members.
results.name: DMV Social and Successful Events

topics.name: Dining Out, BBQs, Food Fairs, Happy Hour and More

results.description: This is for all of us who live, work, and/or play in Wheaton, MD. Let's get together, meet new people, and make some friends, all while having fun dining out, grabbing drinks, or whatever other social activities strike our fancy. At our core will be dining and happy hours. There are lots of fantastic food options right outside our front doors. Apparently there are over 126 food establishments in Wheaton, which gives plenty of options to get out and explore, even after dropping the various fast food joints or the mall food court. I know there are several on my list that I haven't tried yet but want too, and others that I enjoy but just don't get out and frequent enough. Then we'll see what else we want to do. Probably things like getting a group together to head to the TGIF Summer Concert Series and Taste of Wheaton events, having a cookout in Sligo Creek Park or a member's backyard, or ordering takeout or delivery for a game night or to watch a game. All while keeping it local and supporting our neighborhood establishments.
results.name: Wheaton Eatin' & Social Club

results.description: “This is a group for anyone interested in participating in an open dialogue about the rule of the game called ‘MONEY’ and how to WIN it? We are going to meet and share ideas on how to improve our financial situations.  It will be an interactive, fun and thought provoking discussion; everyone is expected to bring something to table i.e. - practical knowledge or past experiences, things that did/didn't work. We will offer some professional expertise to members as needed because we realize that People do not plan to fail, they just fail to plan. The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over, expecting different result. We are going to encourage and help each other to figure out the right way of thinking and what need to be revamped to reach our financial goals. I am looking for a group of people who are sick and tired of their current situation and looking for an avenue to let it out, have an adult conversation and talk their ways into a new way.  We are going to explore how to make, save and accumulate money the right way. I look forward to exploring some basic financial concept to help members how to build a Strong Financial House. Knowledge is not powerful unless it is applied. Hope you can join us"
results.name: Owings Mills Knowledge Sharing Meetup- How Money Works?

results.description: The Severna Park Taphouse hosts open Mic Nights and Live Music on a regular basis and this meet up was set up to bring together local talent and music lovers. Check out our website for more information and directions www.severnaparktaphouse.com.
results.name: Severna Park Live Music/Open Mic Meetup

results.description: The Central Maryland Smart Talks Meetup is devoted to spreading ideas and sharing knowledge through short, powerful tech-driven talks (1 hour). We welcome people from across various disciplines and seek to create a culture of like-minded collaboration. results.description: It's classy, sophisticated and comes with an air of power. Yes, there is nothing like a really good glass of whiskey. This group is about bringing people together all walks-of-life and professions over one common interest - a really good glass of whiskey. And as most people know, some of the best business connections are made over a drink. Don't think you "like" whiskey straight-up? Think again. It is all about developing your pallet, and trying different ones, to find which you like the best. Let me tell you, the flavors are complex and amazing once you start to appreciate the art of it. So, if you are looking to find "your drink," a newbie or pro, simply a whiskey-lover, or generally appreciate alcohol and its history, then join the Annapolis Whiskey Lovers Meetup.

results.description: This is a group for entrepreneurs and Small Business Owners that want to connect with other experts in the area, collaborate, brainstorm ideas and issues and create business relationships. It’s a simple concept. You know your area of expertise, you know your time, you know your availability, share an hour and recommend a Topic, Time, Place and a brief description of what you could chat about over coffee - and Suggest a Meetup. Anyone in the group that is in need of your expertise and has availability can RSVP with you. You can work out the details after that. All members requesting to join this group must have a website or some online profile/portfolio ahead of being accepted. This is a group for professionals who are looking to make professional connections. It’s also a great group for those of us that don't have a lot of flexibility to network after hours, now you can use that hour that you were going to spend at your favorite cafe anyway, to connect with other professionals. Lets collaborate over coffee.

results.description:
Big things start with small beginnings...

Have you ever had a great idea but didn't have everything you needed to develop/commercialize it? You are not alone; even the largest companies in the world have this problem!

For most, it is capital that is needed, while others may require specialized skillsets, materials, facilities, industry connections, data, etc...

Innovative X is an organization dedicated to building an environment that connects local ideas and global resources together. It is a worldwide community where individuals, companies, organizations and academia collaborate and share resources to develop any novel idea imaginable; an environment where artists, programmers, inventors, makers, investors, movie makers, engineers, scientists, and many others form teams and cross-pollinate to create a synergy not found elsewhere.


At our meetings, there is something for everyone…

Those with ideas: We believe that the most critical resource in the idea development process is honest and direct feedback. So at every meeting we provide opportunities for up to four people/companies to share their ideas. Preparing to communicate an idea in under five minutes encourages participants to clarify their vision, which is very helpful for pitching to investors and recruiting team members. We then break up into small groups and focus all efforts and resources on advancing the ideator towards commercialization.

Service Providers: Do you offer a product or service that facilitates the idea development process? Are you an expert in a particular field? Do you have experience working with service providers? If you fit into any of these categories, these meetings are an opportunity for you to shine by networking, demonstrating your knowledge and assisting other members.

Those who have NO ideas, and are NOT service providers: People often under-estimate their value to others, discounting a lifetime of experience, miscellaneous skills, and their roles as consumers, employees, and trendsetters. Because Innovative X is open to any idea, even obscure resources can be in great demand! Learn from what others are doing, avoid common mistakes, mingle with movers and shakers, and generate new ideas!

 So surround yourself with creative and innovative people that are shaping our tomorrow. Attend our meetings and share ideas and experience, seek assistance and guidance in developing your own ideas, make important contacts, build or join teams to collaborate on projects, learn about new and emerging technologies and trends, and gain access to essential resources.

Attendance is free! Be sure to check out our Central Pennsylvania and Baltimore, MD chapters!


**Please note that our sole focus is the development of ideas and the process to make it happen. Those with no interest in this process are encouraged to pursue other, more pertinent meetup.
results.name: INNOVATIVE X-Baltimore Chapter

results.description:
I was inspired to start this group by the need to find more young people who enjoy the outdoors and want something to do on the weekends besides bars and tv! This group is for anyone who is looking to improve their physical, mental, and emotional health! Whether you have goals of wanting to lose body fat, weight, gain energy, learn how to eat better, build lean muscle, or even promote more youthful aging.. I am here to help you reach these goals with nutritional cleansing! We will share tips, tricks, & information to promote your health & well-being! Please feel free to invite others to this meetup! I am determined to spread health & wellness throughout all of Maryland. Six months ago I began this program and not only did I lose 20 lbs in 2 months but I also felt the best I ever have in my life. I gained natural energy, my skin cleared up, and my inflammation went down due to eating proper foods.

We'll cover a variety of topics such as how to choose a content management system, hosting services, audio and visual systems, network systems, etc. We'll discuss ways to analyze risk, keep your organization's/staffs'/donors'/constituents' data secure while making your environment interactive. Web design, social-media outreach, SEO, and online marketing may also be an intrinsic part of reaching your goals, so we'll discuss those as well.

results.description:
As a once and future scientist and an explorer, I can tell you it's important to meet, network, and gain feedback from fellow scientists in order to stay motivated and keep your work growing. So drag yourself out of your laboratory or classroom or particleboard cage and meetup with other like-minded scientific citizens, right here, real soon! Whether you are just starting out or are retired now, our meetups are for you to mix and mingle with leaders and adepts in fields we pioneer. 

About the name. You may know that character who shows up in every so many cartoons, holding a flask that has just blown up in his face? Many cultures know him as "The Mad Scientist." Well, s/he is a symbol of unflappable curiosity, thirsty for discovery, and this is (minus the explosions) our mascot as well! This is also to identify us as people with a playful side who are interested in or passionate, or hog-whole crazy about science. Naturally, we care about more than just the hard sciences of Physics, Chemistry, and Biology; we do wealthily endorse this world's worth of closely related disciplines--you said it--from medicine to astronomy, engineering civilly or socially, paleoecology finds to finding chemical prospecting, for the sake of payloads of nanobots to come, and so on. And on!e

"Science is the only institution that rewards those who change the status quo." Carl Sagan taught me that. And that's what we're going to try to do! When we have to retreat in defeat, we will, and we will return redoubled with another puzzle to tackle! "Bring it up to date or leave it where it was hundreds of years ago." I said that..

With every best wish,

Donald
results.name: Mad Scientists

results.description: Let's get together to knit in the McHenry Row area of Baltimore. We'll meet once a week at Harris Teeter's cafe area and share our skills, knowledge and creativity with fellow knitters. We can also head out for a meal or a drink afterward.

results.description:
Welcome! This group is for young DINK couples (Double Income, No Kids) living in Howard and Montgomery Counties getting together for social events. Our social events include dinners out, happy hours, movies, concerts, wine tastings, dancing, festivals, brunch, hiking, bowling, sporting events, etc. We are also open to people suggesting and/or planning fun events for the group. Please feel free to share any suggestions! The reason my husband and I created the group is to meet other couples around our age that can get together without worrying about finding a babysitter. We love kids and think they are great, but we like our "just us" time, our ambitions, traveling, and sleeping in on weekends just a little bit more! 

We welcome all dating and married couples and if you are single, too. We look forward to seeing you at some of our events.

results.description: A women’s group in this area is hard to find for women in their 40's and over 50 so I decided to establish one. I think there are a number of women in this area, who wish to meet other women with similar interest. The purpose of this group is to allow woman to come together and establish genuine friendships by socializing and communicating with each other. As women, we can come together and be supportive by sharing our experiences, both personal and professional. Activities for this group will be local outings such as movies, dining out, jazz night out, plays, concerts and outdoor events. Other activities could be a one day trip to New York, Crab Feast across the bridge or a weekend getaway. I encourage all member to make suggestions that are appropriate for this group. Meet ups can be scheduled as often as the members wish. Normally, meet ups are held one to two times a month. Each member should become involved with the group and everyone should motivate and encourage each other. The ultimate goal is to RELAX and have plenty of FUN. In order to cover the monthly meetup fee, a small yearly fee of no more than $5 will be required and any activity cost. Is this group designed for what you have in mind? If yes, you are welcomed to join us. I am excited to meet all of you ! Your Meetup Organizer

results.description:
Iranian American Academics and Professionals (IAAP), formerly known as Iranian Academic Association-DC (IAADC), aims at providing a medium for Iranian-American academics and professionals to interact and network on a local and national basis.


Presently, an important activity of IAAP is the monthly lecture series (2nd Thursday of each month) which is open to the public. The lecture series provides a platform for the local professional community to listen to Iranian scholars and professionals presenting intriguing topics related to their field of expertise.

Another important annual activity at IAAP is the offering of student scholarship awards to a limited number of full time undergraduate and graduate students studying in the universities located in the DC metropolitan area and the vicinity States. The application process and deadline are announced on our website (http://iaapdc.org)

results.description:
Are you interested in making significant changes in your life and in other lives?  Do you believe that prayers change things and there is power where two or more are gather in prayer? Do you have enough LOVE in your heart to pray for another in need? Are you humble enough to pray for someone without judgment? This group is branched from a larger national purpose geared specifically towards building the African American community through promoting a greater focus on heatlhy relationships.  However, all ethnicities are encouraged to join this meetup.

results.description:
Energetic fasting, or Bigu (避谷), has long been a tradition for health and longevity in Taoist & Buddhist practice. There are many documented benefits from reduced calorie-intake and fasting, especially in terms of slowing down aging process, detoxifying body, cleansing digest system, and increasing energy balance. A recent research reported that fasting for 2 days could promote cell regeneration of the immune system. A national conference was hold (2000) in Penn State to explore health benefits and scientific research of Qigong Bigu with 500+ attendants. With appropriate guidance and careful monitoring, Qigong fasting can be a safe and effective way for health and healing, and for boosting outcomes of mind-body practice. http://www.scribd.com/doc/40294944/Bigu-Conference-Report... 


This training group will meet in person twice a year, 4-day each time, to teach and promote qigong fasting, and to exchange information and experiences during other time.-- Please check back for more details on each training section, and feel free to post questions or comments about fasting.


With guidance and supervision of master Faxiang Hou, Dr. Kevin Chen will teach turtle breathing, skin-breathing meditation, and a set of fasting Qigong exercises with instruction and Q&A, share the techniques on how to cleanse and purify your body, including the liver, kidney and lungs. Cleansing your body & blood of toxins helps balancing your energy! Many students joint master Hou three times a year for 16 years in this type of training & practice…. (See http://www.qigongresearchsociety.com for more details). The class and training will not only make your fasting easier and less suffering, but also share some ancient wisdoms on diet and body cleanse in daily life.
results.name: Maryland Qigong Fasting (Bigu) Training & Meetup

results.description: I created this group to see if there are others out there interested in weapons training. I've done a mix of martial arts for the last 20 years, getting instructorship in the variety of arts Tribe-K teaches. I'm not looking to start a school up here right now, and neither am I interested in joining any other school. But I would like to get some practice and share with and learn from others. This group is open to anyone wanting to learn, practice and share what they know about weapons. Training could in theory range from simple stick and knife work, to throwing knives, to firearms, depending on who wants to lead instruction. The only rule I have for this group is that you do not disparage other arts. You can think you and your system is the best, but keep it to yourself and let your actions speak louder than your words. So, Interested? Let me know, and once we get a couple people we'll find a place and start training.
results.name: Severn Weapon Skills Practice Group

topics.name: Exploring The World - Traveling and Excursions

results.description: For people with a passion for travel. Let's get together to plan our next getaway! The world is waiting for us to explore. Yes, I am a travel planner and want to share my passion of travel with others. We will meet for all of you to decide where you would like to explore next. You dream.....I do the work! So if you are ready share travel ideas and have them come true this is the group for you.
results.name: You Had Me At Vacation Meetup

results.description:
Nature-loving Toddlers is a community group based mostly in Catonsville, Md. We aim to provide activities in which parents can interact and teach their babies/toddlers about nature. It’s never too late to teach a child to love the outdoors, but, it sure is easier the earlier we start. This group is for parents and babies/toddlers who want to get out and enjoy nature. If your babe is too young to crawl or walk, get a good child carrier – a backpack if they can sit up – and join us on walks on a paved trail, hikes in Patapsco, or play dates and picnics at the park. All with them, right there, in the carrier.

Our group is ideal for active stay-at-home moms/dads, but we welcome working parents, grandparents, and nannies as well. The ideal age group we are looking to have join fall within the newborn to 3 year old age range...with a smattering of older siblings joining in where appropriate when school is out or during the weekend events. Baby friendly dogs will also be allowed to attend specific events.

Please see the “Pages” tab at the top for complete information about Nature-Loving Toddlers etiquette.

**Below is a list of the things we would like to do this spring/summer**

Weekly Picnics at the Park (Monday)- a different park will be chosen each week along with an object, plant, or animal to learn about. The host will provide a few learning materials and crafts but members are encouraged to pitch in by bringing snacks or toys/crafts that go along with the weekly theme. If it rains, we will move the event to Storyville. 

Weekly Walks (Thursday)- a different paved path will be chosen each week and the same topic/theme chosen for the picnic will be the focus on the walk. If it rains, this event will most likely be cancelled unless anyone has a great idea for an indoor walk besides the mall. 

Weekend Hikes and Nature Walks in Patapsco- a guided hike in Patapsco State Park will take place every weekend throughout spring and summer.  The hikes will vary from easy to moderate and may progress later in the season. They could range from one hour to three hours. If we have more experienced hikers who have joined the group then we can explore the idea of adding on an additional more experienced hike. If it rains, the hikes will be rescheduled or cancelled.

Announce and Attend Local Events- various times throughout the year we are planning to meet up at the local events. Those events could include Library events, local fairs, Friday night concert, etc...

Field trips- once a quarter or more we plan on taking a field trip! Clarks Elioak Petting Zoo and Larriland Farm (pick your own) are just a couple of the ideas we have come up. 

All events will be stroller accessible except for the hikes.

If you have any suggestions on parks, trials, local events, or field trips, please let us know! We are continuously looking for new places to explore!
results.name: Nature-Loving Toddlers in 21228

results.description:
Let's get together for yoga classes in Laurel on (1) FRIDAYS from 7-8pm: Unwind and end a busy week with a restorative yoga class that involves deep stretching and an extended savasana (relaxation) and (2)SATURDAYS from 8:30-9:30am: Build strength and flexibility in a heated vinyasa flow class. Vinyasa means breath linked with movement.

Studies show that yoga offers countless mental and physical health benefits: reducing insomnia, combating depression, stress management and relaxation, improved concentration and focus, lowering blood pressure and blood sugar associated with diabetes, improved strength and flexibility, stretching tight or stiff muscles and joints and so much more.

Never done yoga before or a beginner? We absolutely WELCOME and ENCOURAGE you to attend. As long as you're breathing, you CAN do yoga. Flexibility is not required. Classes are tailored for all ages and fitness levels. Come with an OPEN mind and heart and be READY to have fun!!! 

Please wear comfortable clothing and bring a yoga mat if you have one (we have loaner mats and other props available if you don't), a towel and water.

Cost: $15 for a single drop-in session or $80 for a 10-class pack.  You may pay in-person or sign up online: http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=176...

Yoga with Tyree is located in the Laurel Lakes Executive Park in Laurel directly in front of the lake.  The studio is inside the Pierce Group Suite (the last suite on the right side of the building complex). Questions? Please call 443-574-5434 or email yogawithtyree@gmail.com. Also, please like or follow me on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram "Yoga with Tyree" for more information and updates. See you soon!

The Language meetings will be for all levels, but probably leaning more towards beginners. The culture meeting will be of varying events, from Festivals to History. From Anime to JPop. topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description: We are a blend of Conservative, Republican and Liberty Activists of all ages, races and creeds, whose aim is to bring personal freedom and responsibility to our community.  We believe in obeying the U.S. and State of Maryland Constitutions, limited government, property rights, civil rights, low taxes, low government-spending, protecting the unborn, and our 2nd Amendment Right to Bear Arms.  Freedom means exercising your rights however you like, as long as you don't interfere with another person's rights.   If you want to make sure that our elected officials are PROTECTING our rights and not trampling-upon them, you have found the right group.  Welcome Home!
results.name: Harford County Campaign for Liberty

I want to spend this special Love Day with good people who have suffered loss but insist on finding beauty, light and laughter in their new lives.

results.description:
The weekend of February 13-14, 2015 is the FIRST Global Divestment Day from fossil fuels (hundreds of events all around the world!)
http://gofossilfree.org
If you are concerned about the environment and convinced that oil, gas, or coal should stay in the ground where it belongs, there is a movement for you. We can make the unthinkable (independence from fossil fuel energy) happen - and faster than anyone would have thought!
With the successful strategy of divestment (against apartheid and tobacco), we can convince pension funds, universities, and any investment institution, to move its money out of fossil fuel companies and put it instead into renewable energy.
Students are at the forefront of this movement but there is so much to do in our communities. Let's get together and develop plans of action that will work for every one involved.
KICK-OFF EVENT on Friday, Feb. 13 at 5:30pm in Timonium. Please sign up!
http://act.350.org/event/gdd/10167
results.name: Baltimore Divestment from fossil fuels Meetup

results.description:
Black African Dance styles came to Brazil and everybody loved it. Period. WikiUp the rest!


That's me, on the left, with a Carnavalesco, down in Rio. He spends 9 months of every year sculpting Styrofoam that goes on the floats in the parades going on in heavy, heavy Samba competition. I'm made out like a "Sons of Gandhi" from Salvador de Bahia and if you knew about them. . . . Forget it. I'm going to make this MeetUp easy & awesome, or the next organizer is YOU.


That means you can listen to her. Or somebody else the DJ puts on. No dance lessons. We will be going clubbing to our own events together. I'm so White I'm blond. Have a couple drinks, have a legal toke in one of DC's fine alleys, approach me, the other guy, the other girl, you get it, and we'll dance. I like a few small dancehalls, that's it. Ya'll talk soon.


Brazil's getting older, but richer and browner, too. Fun and funny, this former housemate of mine (below), a computer programmer up in our old penthouse, is a lovely young gay dude who says it all!!


Signing off,

Your new (Interim) Organizer for now,

Donald ["Donal-GEE"]


Talk soon!

DreamAwake Unlimited presents a writing for wellness journey. Creative writing is more than imagination on paper. It is a creative process, yes, but it is also a creating process. For with our words (both spoken and written) we shape and reshape the world around us, and likewise within us. 

Therapeutic writing is different than creative writing in that it is a form of healing.  It has the power to reduce stress, relieve anxiety and release fears.  This group is a healing circle that uses writing as a medium to release emotionally and revive spiritually. Join us twice a month to write and refresh as a healing community.

Each session begins with a meditation to awaken the creative spark and open the heart.  This group is both educational and interactive.  You will learn about the many therapeutic benefits of writing, as well as, become a part of a healing community.

results.description:
The Get Up, Move, and Explore (Gum_E) the DMV meetup was created for men and women to keep each other motivated as we strive to increase our physical activity. We are not a Hiking Group, but we may hike. We are not a Walking Group, but we need to walk. We are a Moving Group, so Let’s Move.

This group will look to each other to keep motivated since it's easy to lose motivation noting this is the 2nd attempt at this successful group. Members should suggest things to do or even host events themselves. Hiking , walking, shopping, dancing,  healthy eating, trails, community center classes, joint- meetups, etc. …. the organizer is game. Everyone moves at the pace that is comfortable to them. It doesn’t matter if you are fast or slow. The slow ones will be encouraged to move as fast as the fast ones and the fast ones will be encouraged to keep striving forwarded or they might end up like the slow ones :-) If you are trying something new, you should consult your doctor 1st. Your safety is important to us and it should be to you too.

So if you’re on a journey to be more active, and don’t mind pulling people along who are losing motivation, this group is for you. Let's shout it loudly : While the organizer is a couch potato, there are fitness buffs in the group. This group just asks for you to be courteous of other people’s time planning and showing up to events by not having no-shows or last minute cancelations.

The Let’s Move Campaign isn’t the reason the group started but it was one of the driving factors. Non-Moms do the “Mom Dance” just as much

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq-URl9F17Y

Let's stop talking or thinking about what we are going to do and let's start doing it. Now Let's Have Some Fun and feel free to give event suggestions.
results.name: Get Up, Move, and Explore the DMV-Phase II

results.description:
Travel as a visitor, not as a traditional tourist. Make friends around the world. Learn about other cultures first-hand. How can you do these things? Come to our events and meet members of the Friendship Force of the National Capital Area (Washington, DC area) and hear our stories of our adventures. As part of our club, you can meet people of other countries and cultures by staying in their homes while visiting their country, by hosting them in your home, or by simply meeting them at events we hold during their visit. We share meals, conversation and the routines of daily life, creating a unique cultural encounter and lasting friendships. When we visit or host another club, the club organizes a program of activities to introduce the visitors to the local area (for us, this can include visits to museums, the Capitol, nearby cities such as Annapolis, and more). Our Friendship Force club is affiliated with Friendship Force International, which was founded in 1977 with the mission "to promote global understanding across the barriers that separate people." There are 375 clubs in 60 countries on six continents. Most of our members live in Virginia, Maryland, the District of Columbia. We hold events throughout the metropolitan area, such as dinners or brunches in restaurants, pot-luck meals at various locations, a swim party/picnic, and more.

Find out more about our club at ffnca.org or on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/FriendshipForceNationalCapitalArea. Learn about Friendship Force International at www.friendshipforce.org.
results.name: Travel & Cultural Exchange - DC Area Friendship Force

results.description: Startup Soiree is a meetup that takes place on the last Thursday of every month; focused on creating meaningful conversations among business founders, owners and leaders within the local community. Our inspiration comes from the understanding that founders, owners and leaders must develop an accelerated understanding of the complexities that arise while building a company. Who better to help you overcome those creative hurdles than peers. Peers in Baltimore. Peers who have done it before. Peers who do it every day. Startup Soiree offers a unique opportunity to tap into a vast network of resources: mentors, advisors, partners, and friends. We are focused on developing relationships with like-minded individuals and uncovering potential areas of collaboration. Join us for local food and drink, and participate in our town-hall style conversation, specifically geared toward the opportunities and challenges of being a founder, The format of the three hour event is: 6:30-7:30pm Cocktail Hour with beer, wine, and local food 7:30-8:30pm Town Hall Style Discussion on crowd-sourced topics, moderated by a Guest of Honor 8:30-9:30pm Continued Private Conversations and Party Time! Music and cocktails! Want to come? We'd love to have you! Request an invite to Startup Soiree. www.startup-soiree.com For more Startup Soiree happenings, check us out on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Looking forward to exploring the "WORLD" with everybody from everywhere!  Our motto "Let's meet up, and Tune in...TURN UP!!!  From cruises, to exotic  I started this group to meet and network with other "FUN-LOVING" drama-free like minded travel enthusiasts. Looking forward to exploring the "WORLD" with everybody! We just want to travel the world and meet new people along the way!  Come join us at one of our next meetups and live and see the world!


This is a drama free meetup group.  We promote travel for folks looking to expand their circle of friends and travel partners.  If there is something posted you don't agree with, then you don't have to attend.  We like to reach a wide range of travel enthusiasts, so every trip wont be for you.  We promote packages and some are more expensive than others. results.description:
Join for FREE and expand your professional network. You'll be invited to attend fabulous lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) professional networking social events at gay-friendly lounges in Maryland. Our members are hard-working people from a variety of disciplines such as military, government, banking, law, medicine, new media, interior or fashion design and communications. We all share the same desire to enjoy the company of like-minded professionals in a relaxed, fun atmosphere.

Our group is welcoming and inclusive, respectful of everyone under the gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) rainbow and straight allies. Build a stronger base of professional contacts. Share ideas and job possibilities, tap expertise, or meet potential clients or business partners. Benefit by making new connections and honing ideas. There are no membership dues to be a part of it. Nor are there referral expectations like BNI's. Just show up, meet new people, and have fun!

Founded by TJ Flavell, this group sets an exciting new paradigm. Established in 2015. it includes all gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) professionals and allies in Maryland. It's a new day, a new era, and this facilitates valuable connections for personal, professional, and business success.

Better yet, you may join this cosmopolitan group regardless of where you reside, be it DC, NoVA, Maryland or wherever, you are welcome. Our events are the rage! This group hosts a monthly networking social at an exciting venue in Maryland. Join today for free to stay informed about these and other upcoming events.

results.description:
Island Fit Lifestyle presents the most serious and fun workouts you will ever have in your gym experience. It is a 40 minute high impact group fitness class that uses the most effective Caribbean dances to sculpt and tone the entire body. This unique class tricks your body into shape while mastering simple but effectively challenging island dance moves. 

ReggaeTone is our main technique. It focuses on movements that tone and strengthen the body using the best reggae, dancehall, zouk, soca, calypso, bachata, and merengue dances from the Caribbean islands. ReggaeTone will increase agility, total body strength, and cardiovascular endurance by incorporating Plyometrics and Pilates  in the dance workouts..  Join us every week for 1 hour at the Instructional Fitness Training Center (IFTC) in Owings Mills Maryland! 

Trial periods,  7 day passes, and $10.00 non-member tickets are readily available!  Call the Instructional Fitness Training Center at (410) 654-5522 for details prior to the class.

"Like" our page on Facebook,  https://www.facebook.com/IslandFitLifestyle

results.description: Hi...thanks for checking out this group! I wanted to join a meet up group to meet other moms and friends for my little guy, but it seems like most of the groups for toddlers meet during the week. I am a single, full-time working momma so that just doesn't work for us. Me and my son love getting out of the house during the weekend and going on new adventures (hey even a trip to the park is an awesome adventure for a 20 month old!). So I thought why not create my own meet up group and invite other moms and their little ones to join us?! This group is for toddler age kids and their moms. My son is VERY active (I'm sure the other boy moms out there can relate?;)) so most of the activities we will do will let the kids be kids (play, run around, have a generally grand time). We'll also have holiday themed activities (I LOVE pretty much every holiday!), Mom's night out events (This group will stay fairly small so we can all get to know each other) and when it gets warmer stroller walks and lots of other outdoor activities (YAY for warmer weather!). So if this sounds like something you'd be interested please join up! We'd love to have you! *But please only join the group if you are intending to come out to events. The group will be limited to 50 people so we want to let the ones who are going to come join. Thanks! :)
results.name: It's Toddler Time!

results.description: Interested in joining Rotary? We are a service club with 1.2 million members worldwide. Our College Park club was chartered in 1935. Our sole purpose is to raise funds to donate to charities both locally and internationally. We meet every Wednesday evening for dinner starting at 6:30 PM at The University of Maryland Golf Course. We discuss our current charitable projects, and great fun and interesting guest speakers. For those that become a member of our Rotary Club, by the rules of Rotary International, you are expected to attend at least 50% of all meetings each year, and pay your semi-annual dues on January 1st and July 1st. Being asked to join Rotary is an honor. You will be among like minded people that care about their community, and do something about it! Members are professionals and business owners from all walks of life. Come to a meeting and check out the great work of Rotary!
results.name: Rotary Club of College Park, Maryland

results.description: I love reading books that give me a sense of empowerment, make me feel inspired and give me the keys to ALLOWING a happier life. And then I want to chew on those concepts with others and hear about all the increased joy they’re feeling! Some self helps books use terminology that is not a perfect match to how would describe something, but their intentions are all quite the same anyway. I just take what I can get from them, allowing them to clarify the beliefs I find to be most valuable. _______________________ The format for this book club could be that we choose one specific book to read and then discuss. But if folks would prefer just bringing in ANY book they’re currently reading and discussing any way in which it makes them FEEL BETTER - that’s fine too. I’m going to host the first few meetings at my house, until another member of the group feels comfortable hosting at hers - so we can be most comfortable and hear each other (which is often hard in a public place). _________________ If you’d like to read a book in common, for our first meeting, may I suggest: "How to Rule the World From Your Couch" - this is basically about using the massive leverage of intuition before you take physical action. Great stuff. You know how science says we're only using 10% of our brains? After reading this book, I had moments where I felt like I was using my brain in a whole different way and - making a difference - from my couch! Find it here, http://www.amazon.com/How-Rule-World-Your-Couch/dp/1439123586/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1424790943&sr=1-1&keywords=How+to+Rule+the+World+From+Your+Couch And soon after, let’s read this - I loved it! Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less http://www.amazon.com/Essentialism-The-Disciplined-Pursuit-Less/dp/0804137382
results.name: "Uplifting Stuff! Women's Book Club" - in Annapolis

results.description:
The Audubon Naturalist Society seeks to create a larger and more diverse community of people in the DC region who treasure the natural world and work to preserve it. Join us for nature walks and programs at our Woodend Sanctuary in Chevy Chase, MD and further afield.  Come learn about our region's bird species at free Saturday walks for beginning birders.  Attend one of our naturalist author events.  Join one of our volunteer teams to steward our sanctuary, monitor water quality in local streams or help educate the next generation of environmental leaders.

The Audubon Naturalist Society, headquartered in Chevy Chase, is the DC region's oldest independent environmental organization. ANS inspires residents of the greater Washington, DC, region to appreciate, understand, and protect their natural environment through outdoor experiences, education, and advocacy.   Find us on the web at www.audubonnaturalist.org

Nudist Bill of Right:

• As law-abiding citizens who are friends of nudism,  including many  members of the American Association for Nude Recreation,  we proudly affirm that we have and are entitled to exercise the following rights. These are self-evident and based on the Constitutions of the United States and Canada, the laws of those countries, and their court rulings.

• Nudists have the right to hold their values and beliefs.

Nudists have the right to petition and be heard by their governments.

• Nudists have the right to responsibly enjoy nudity within their homes and on private property.

• Nudists have the right to exercise decision-making in the upbringing of their families in a manner consistent with their beliefs and without interference from others.

• Nudists have the right to assemble in the nude within appropriate settings.Nudists have the right to decisions about what constitutes acceptable nudity to be made free from considerations of age, gender, marital status, religious beliefs, ethnic origin, or sexual orientation.

• Nudists have the right to responsibly enjoy being nude within appropriate locations on public lands.

• Nudists have the right to be free from adverse actions by their employers as a result of their lawful enjoyment of nudity when away from work.

• Nudists have the right to experience accurate, life-affirming portrayals of the human body in all its stages as depicted in the performing arts, the fine arts, literature, and human history.

• Nudists have the right to be treated as law-abiding citizens.

Who are Welcome here:

• Couples

• Families

• Singles

results.description:
BMORE FRIENDS IN SMALL GROUPS

First, watch this trailer and laugh: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mgQfXXVolwE

WHAT WE'RE ABOUT

You've had trouble making strong friends. You have a job (or you're a student), a car, and you live in a decent place. You may or may not be new to Baltimore. You've tried the typical MeetUp gigs, but aren't satisfied with the large get-togethers and people you've met there. You're looking for a genuine, reliable set of friends that you can be yourself around and enjoy good times with. You want to try a variety of activities and are tired of the same-old bar scene. All of your friends are coupled and difficult to get a hold of. You want to meet other singles who do what you do, and you'd like to get to know a small group of people steadily, over time. Perhaps you're coupled yourself, but want to get out and develop your own social circle independent of your partner's. You don't have any spectacular talents, but you're an interesting person and have a desire for a strong, fun social base.

If this sounds like you, then BMFSG is your kind of MeetUp. Our get-togethers are generally limited to a few people, so you can get to know those you spend time with. Our goal is to create a fun, welcoming atmosphere where people can establish meaningful connections with each other, enjoy good conversation, and just hang out and enjoy life. We are LGBTQ-friendly.  

IF YOU'RE A STUDENT . . .

You will find this group helpful in meeting study buddies to stay motivated, keep accountable, and share cafe time with. As a doctoral fellow myself, I routinely post study sessions at various Baltimore coffeeshops. This will get you out of your house, into the city, and mingling with people while you put together that bibliography or crunch those numbers. Who ever said scholars needed to stay cooped up at home?

IF YOU WORK . . .

You will find a diverse outlet for your social needs here, since you will be mixing with people from all walks of life. Our group will help you branch out from your typical work colleagues and spend time with people doing other interesting things with their lives. This will provide you with a greater sense of variety, balance, and satisfaction.

WHERE DO WE MEET?

Our events will be all around the Charm City, and possibly even in nearby Annapolis. We encourage members to suggest events, and will be considering new ideas regularly. Don't worry: this is not some sort of support group. It's simply for people who recognize that they have had trouble making friends and would like to do something about it. 

REQUIREMENTS: AGE, PHOTO, QUESTIONS

BMFSG only accepts members between the ages of 21 and 35. You must also have a photo of yourself in your profile and answer our group's questions so that we know something about you.
results.name: BMFSG: BMore Friends in Small Groups

results.description:
Our new male summer share!

Are you a beach lover, do you love water and water sports do you want to enjoy this summer at the beach as much as possible?  

If you are in you are in your 30's or 40's, professional, mature, positive, young at heart, community oriented, can go with the flow, not clique-ish and don't feel entitled to disregard others, then you are perfect for this meetup.  Let's leave work and the DMV behind, hit the Bay Bridge and head to the beach every other weekend starting the weekend of May 30th. 

We'll share a house, spend time basking in the sun, hit all the local beaches from Assateague to Wildwood, go jet skiing, deep sea fishing, surfing, kayaking, SUPing, play beach volleyball, bike, hike and dine out or cook out at the houses.

This is not a drinking group, this is a group for active beach lovers, that are genuinely interested in the Salt Life. This is a small group of Salt Lifers interested in spending weekends at the shore. Some may decide this is not the right time or the right group.  Sharing a house with strangers is a big commitment, you will need to make the best decision for your personal circumstances.  Our main goal is to have a stress-free harmonious summer at the beach with new friends.  You must be active to remain in the group. 

All Salt Lifers must own 4 of the following.  A bike, boat, jet ski, surfboard, paddle board, boogie board, bathing suit and/or a positive attitude. 

We have 2 houses this summer - Women on the Go-Go and our new house Salt-Lifers the male house.  If you are an active beach loving Women on the Go-Go click Here
results.name: Salt Lifers: 2015 Summer Beach Share II

Check http://octo.dc.gov/page/dc-one-card for what you should bring with you when registering for a card. Wilson Aquatic Center: 4551 Fort Dr NW Washington, DC 20016 Closest Metro: Tenleytown (Red Line) Public Bar Tenley: 4611 41st St Washington, DC 20016 Closest Metro: Tenleytown (Red Line)

results.description:
We are a twelve year old book club of women 50+ and we are  adding new members as some of our group have moved out of the area and we are now only about 10.  Meetings are held monthly in the founders home in Kensington/Silver Spring, MD every 2nd Sunday of the month from 5:00-7:00+. Everyone brings a dish and we discuss that month's book over dinner. Our group is mostly divorced women 50+ with a shared love of not only the well written word, but the arts too (theater, galleries, good movies, music, PBS) and those interested do some  of those things together as well. Some of us are also artists or crafts women doing creative projects like knitting, quilting, crocheting, beading, jewelry making, painting, etc.). However, the important thing we all have in common is our appreciation of really good literature, well written books that inspire, and our yearly picks include no "fluff". So, this is a great group for serious readers (not that some of us don't read mysteries, suspense, non fiction, etc. on the side too). 
We look forward to knowing you, however, because we meet in the founders  home, she will contact you directly  and ask you to call her so you can talk a bit first. Warm Regards.

results.description: Are you fed up with the policy gridlock, hyper-partisanship, name-calling, and ever widening political chasm in our culture? Are you longing for a better way to address society's pressing challenges? This discussion group is based on the idea that it can be possible to find common ground across the political spectrum if we can gain a better understanding of each others perspectives through face to face dialogue. People of all political stripes who are open-minded and curious are welcome. The objectives are to 1) bring together participants with diverse political views, 2) conduct a respectful and productive conversation about a difficult topic in a safe environment, and 3) explore possible areas of common ground. To promote these goals, discussions will be loosely structured around a format called “Living Room Conversations” (see http://www.livingroomconversations.org/), which has been successful in finding common ground between groups as politically disparate as the Tea Party and MoveOn.org. An inaugural meeting is planned for the evening of March 20. To join the conversation or find out more, contact Keith.Kozloff@verizon.net.
results.name: Conversations to Bridge the Political Divide

results.description: In this group we aim to reformulate and unify all knowledge, including ontological mathematics, cosmic evolution, the universal dialectic and ethics into a coherent framework. Since, by definition, existence cannot come from non-existence, an accurate understanding of reality itself requires the acceptance of an “Arche”, an eternal and fundamental basis of reality in a constant state of becoming. Aristotle postulated such reality as a conversion of potential into actuality in an all-encompassing process termed “Entelechy”. This perspective allows for a pivotal understanding of life, intelligence and the divine as evolutionary events occurring along a continuum. God is traditionally viewed as the pinnacle of intelligence, power, and complexity, but existence cannot begin with such qualities. Rather, the universe evolves in complexity over time: it was not created by God, but is God in potentia. Thus we can propose a unification of science and religion in which a creator God is a logical impossibility, but God as the end-product of cosmic evolution is logical. The Universe is converting infinite potential into maximum actualization; and we are participants in the entire process, which is perhaps the ultimate meaning of life.
results.name: Illuminism Institute

We want to be a resource to answer your questions and and help you destroy the roadblocks that have been hindering your success. WE'VE BUILT THIS GROUP FOR PEOPLE WHO ASK THEMSELVES QUESTIONS LIKE: - - How do I start making money in real estate without my own cash, credit, or experience? - How do I start effectively marketing without a huge budget? - Where do I locate the best deals in my area? - What are the best ways to protect myself and stay out of legal trouble when doing deals? - How do I evaluate properties to know whether I've found a deal? If your ready to take action and build your Prince George's County/Washington DC real estate investing business, come join us at our next meetup group session.
results.name: Getting Started in Real Estate Investing PG/DC chapter

results.description:
Spiritual journey a little rocky? Or smooth as a walk along the beach? Either way, walking through life is easier and more interesting with others than alone. We are Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City, and we would love for you to join our meetup. Everyone is welcome. Here are some things we do:

 ~ Quest Discussion Forum is a safe place to discuss life’s questions, such as inner peace and personal views of reality. Engage in robust conversation, or simply bring your spirit and listen. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Mysteries is an open environment to discuss life’s mysteries: space, the quantum world, consciousness, intuition, dreams, free will vs determinism or life’s other big unknowns. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Pathways is a forum for contemporary spiritual ideas based on one of today’s spiritual leaders. Share in meaningful conversation and meditation. Open to anyone 18 and older.

 ~ In Drum Circle, we share the fun of drumming. Open to all ages. Sound like you? Sign up for whatever sounds appealing and check us out. No membership or event fee.

                                                           ___________________________

Events are held at Channing Memorial Unitarian Universalist Church.  Channing is a small, lively, welcoming UU congregation in the Ellicott City area. Our mission is to: invite seekers into spiritual community, connect souls in mystery and wonder, and ignite compassion into action.
results.name: Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City

Have fun while living life to the fullest

Meet other single people who are serious about being in a committed relationship

Learn how to be the best version of ourselves we can be

Experience and enjoy all that the DMV has to offer 

Bond with and enjoy the company of others

Empower each other with the knowledge to start and build a healthy relationship                                

Opportunity to meet your mate

If these are your some of your objectives, we welcome you.

We will only allow Traditional bluegrass instruments - Acoustic 6 String Guitar, Mandolin, Fiddle, Dobro, Upright Bass, and 5 String Banjo. Harmonicas are okay too if you can really play it! Also, acoustic bass is okay if you can't bring the upright. While all are welcome at this jam we will be playing some intermediate to advanced bluegrass. Don't let this scare you away! results.description:
My goals for the group are to help you create portraits where the subject(s) look terrific with great lighting and posing. I will concentrate on those two areas. The kind of camera you have will not matter. I believe you can create a great portrait with the best camera around or a cell phone. 

You should  know how to work your camera. There are many other factors such as backgrounds, clothing and the message you want to convey that go into creating a portrait. Those will all be addressed as needed or in a separate class. The classes are for people who want to improve their people portraits. Anyone can pick up a camera these days and take a photo but to take a portrait to the next level requires more thought, understanding and a lot of practice.  

I'd like to see how the group evolves, but for now we'll get together on location, near Silver Spring, Bethesda and NW and learn about natural portrait posing and lighting. Sometimes we will go for an urban look and other times we might go to a park. We will look for lighting situations that mimic studio lighting without lighting equipment (except maybe a reflector). We will pose each other as singles, couples and groups and occasionally we'll have a model. Next fall I may teach studio portraits. Most of the time we'll meet on Saturday morning and be done before noon.

I look forward to sharing with you. Barbara Glaeser
results.name: Washington Portrait Posing & Lighting Meetup

results.description: Are you interested in learning more about Qigong energy healing? This group is for promoting health and wellness through an ancient practice called QiGong. What is Qigong? Qigong focuses on improving physical health and wellness. It opens the energy flow within the body by eliminating blockages. The intent is to balance the body by opening the energetic pathways (meridians). This is accomplished by a series of gentle movements synchronized with the breath. This form of Qigong can be safely practiced by the beginner, with limited movement, to the most advanced student. It benefits all students and aides them in moving forward no matter what their prior experiences. Each class is started with a set of Opening Moves to allow the body structure to open in all directions. Next, we move through the Qigong movements. These movements focus on Energy passing through specific pathways (or meridians). The class ends with a closing Qigong form that integrates the mind-body-spirit to a more grounded state of well-being. Qigong is an excellent tool to acquire mind-body-spirit awareness. Its movements provide a path toward personal transformation. Each individual may have a different experience each time they practice the form. The goal is as they work toward balance of the Yin-Yang Qi they will notice improved health, increased energy and a greater awareness of life. What are the benefits? Qigong enhances immune function, reduces the ill effects of stress, prevents disease, calms the mind and emotions, lowers blood pressure, increases flexibility, cultivates energy, treats chronic pain, and improves sleep.
results.name: Laurel Qigong Meetup

results.description:
Hey hey! Thanx for checking out The Black Rainbow. This group is for African American lesbians (and gays) under 30 in the Baltimore City area whom are interested in building an overall more positive and productive queer community through artistry and civil engagement.

Well what (tf) does that mean?

Well, a few things. The term "Black" was originally defined as "the absence of color". On the contrary: Black is the Queen of all colors; it is the accumulation of all colors. That being said, this group is for young black lesbians and gays that are multi-faceted in their interests and habits; crave the company of other lesbians and gays that contradict, or go against, the stereotypes of our community; people interested in creating more social events -whether dance, poetry, art, food, or just a chill get-together at a house with some good conversation (and good treats 🌲+🍸**). The in-house gatherings will also consist of general group discussion. Topics will vary, but some include:

- Is there a difference between a "dyke" and a lesbian or "faggy" and a gay male?
- What's "gay" in the gay community? (s4s)
- Lipstick fems to hard butches and all that falls between (fem, ag fem, ag/dom/stud, soft stud, stem, etc.)
- Where does "drama" come from and why is it so prevalent in our community?
- Does "conversion therapy" really work?
- Who wears the pants? (Looking at the need/desire for a "dominant" role in a relationship)

Also, while this isn't a "hookup" group, you could quite possibly find the one for you. Once you're around some folk on a similar wave length, you're bound to bump into someone on your frequency.

In addition, while there is an emphasis for a particular demographic, THIS GROUP FULLY SUPPORTS ALL OTHER LGBTQIA MEETUP GROUPS IN AND AROUND BALTIMORE (Shout out to Women of Color - great group with a similar focus)


As of now, there are very few to no places or events for young black queers to come together, other than a club (hippo) or a party. Much of the "drama" that so many of us detest, in some part, comes from the lack of options we have to choose from as a community that reflect the variety of styles and interests within. Meaning, there seems to be a thick line drawn in the sand between people who love the club and people who hate it. Yet this separation completely discounts the multitude of young black queers that may like to hit the club (or nah) AND do other stuff. The "other stuff" tho, seems to be almost non existent. The Black Rainbow is ultimately for young queers of color to, in effect, be the change we want to see. Theres way too many of us in the city to be so separated. Maybe im enthusiastic because im not from here, but try not to kill the dream and just live it with me for a while.

Let's MEETUP, share some ideas and see if we can't create a entirely new culture for ourselves right here.

I AM ALSO LOOKING FOR ADDITIONAL ORGANIZERS.

**footnote: this group is 420/alcohol friendly, but promotes use in moderation. Each individual is responsible for his/her own actions and will be asked to remove him/herself if he/she forgets what MODERATION means and intoxication makes him/her a problem. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO NEGATIVITY ALLOWED (sounds extreme, i know, but you know our people and you give some an inch...)
results.name: The Black Rainbow

results.description:
We meet at various locations in Baltimore and surrounding areas in Maryland for plein air painting. 

This is a great way to meet other artists and get OPTIONAL feed back on your work from the group. Paint for about 2 1/2 hours, break for lunch, go back to painting if desired or call it a day. We will have a location and meet up times, but, of course, you can start and end whenever you want. Artist's are responsible for bringing their own art supplies, lunches, snack, drinks, suntan lotion,  etc...

*For most locations we will have to walk from  where our cars are parked to a painting location.  I use a rolling cart to carry my art supplies, but a backpack also works. 

*A $4.00  yearly donation would to help  pay the website organization's yearly fees. Thank you!
results.name: Baltimore/Maryland  Plein Air Painters Meetup

results.description:
Are you tired of the "same-old, same-old"? Looking to socialize with other Gay guys (and gals) and couples, but need a break from the Gay bar/club scene? 

Well BALTIMORE GAY SOCIAL is your remedy to lackluster nights out! Put simply, BALTIMORE GAY SOCIAL is a group of fun-loving, discerning people seeking alternatives to the nightlife scene and hook-up apps to meet like-minded guys for friendship and networking. 

Each month we curate fun, interactive weekly + monthly events that encourage members to meet new people face to face in real time, engage more inter-personally sans tech, and develop meaningful lasting friendships....all while being charitable + having fun! <br>

It's about having fun + being SOCIALLY responsible! 

Now press join....it's time to GET SOCIAL! <br>
results.name: Baltimore Gay Social

results.description:
