We encourage people to give their honest opinions, given that they are able to substantiate them.  Many topics may not be politically-correct, but anyone with a sincere interest in current events, history, geopolitics or philosophy should join*!

results.description: This meetup is for developers and designers who work frequently with text-based formats, and are looking to improve their skills, particularly using the Vim editor, though other editor aficionados are welcome to join During our Meetups, we will have between 30-50 minutes of talks, with the remainder of the initial hour dedicated to open forum discussion, allowing users to pose questions or relate problems they've encountered. My daughter was born with a condition in which she has required many surgeries, long hospital stays, and has feeding difficulties.  She has a feeding tube. results.description:
This group is a "clone group" of our main meetup page which is simply called "The Firefly House". The purpose of this is to draw membership from the Maryland area, as we sometimes have events there as well as in DC.

____________________________
We are a tradition of Witchcraft based in the DC/NOVA/MD area. Our meetup is the container for what we call the "outer circle" of participants and members. We are facilitated by a governing coven called Coven of the Spiral Moon, the "inner circle." We put on public rituals for many of the sabbats as well as a number of classes on various Wiccan and Witchcraft-related topics. We are also a Wiccan tradition that people can participate in casually, or through the deeper path of initiation into the outer circle or one of our two coven's. All respectful individuals are welcome to engage in this Great Work of evolving our souls, growing in power, and becoming attuned with this holy Earth.
results.name: The Firefly House (Maryland-Area Members)

Bi, pan, fluid, queer cis ladies/trans ladies of color: Have you walked into an event for "us" and felt so highly underrepresented that you wanted to Beyonce blend into the proverbial elevator wall? Are you tired of being judged in queer spaces the moment people find out you're bi/pan? 

 If you're looking to do things like network, laugh, share stories, bond, have meaningful dialogue, make lasting friendships, socialize, and/or have fun with kick ass people in a safe space, this group is for you! Please, only awesome people need apply. (And if you looked at this page, that's probably you. So, join!)

A gathering will be held weekly for convenience.

results.description:
Join Dr. Elianne Amstalden of the Belvedere Veterinary Center on a hearty Hound Hike to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life and get those pooches out of the house! This is a great opportunity to spend some time with your dog and socialize him/her with other dogs. This is an on leash activity.

When & Where:
Cromwell Valley Park (Willow Grove Farm-East Entrance)

*What? You don't have a dog?
-Don't worry, we can find you a foster dog!

*How do you sign up?
-Just call us at the Belvedere Veterinary Center at 410.999.3300 or email us at mail@belvedereveterinarycenter.com and we will put you on the list.

Rules & Regulations:
-All pet parents must sign up their dogs no later than a day prior to the event.
-All dogs must be on a leash no longer than 6 feet. 
(Retractable leashes are not permitted.)
-All dogs must be up to date on their Rabies Vaccine.
(Proof of Rabies must be emailed or faxed to the Belvedere Veterinary Center.)
-No fraternizing prior to the walk.
-All children in attendance must be at least 8 years old.
 
In the event of inclement weather the Hound Hike may be cancelled. 
Updates will be available on the Belvedere Veterinary Center's website and Facebook page.

*Spaces are limited
results.name: Hound Hike

results.description:
A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection. Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30 with time for socializing afterwards.
results.name: Shamanic Drumming Circle of Timonium

There are no excuses - grab some friends and choose to try something new and fun!

We’ll get the word out about anti-vaccine lies, protest psychics who prey upon the bereaved, and give skeptics a presence at the next “natural” medicine faire. Ready to do the hard work of skepticism? Join us!

results.description:
Welcome! In Susan's Kitchen you will find vegetarian cooking classes. Breathe Ayurveda offers consultations and classes. Meditation on Main is our weekly meditation group! All things to nourish your body, mind and soul. 

Meditation on Main Street with Susan Weis-Bohlen 7 pm - 8:15 pm, every Thursday night! * Tuesday, May 19 Meditation returns to Hampen! See details below CLASS MEETS AT 362 MAIN STREET IN REISTERSTOWN, MD 21136 AT THE CENTER FOR SPIRITUAL LIVING. Thursdays: Join us for a short Dharma talk, meditation instruction, breath-work, and 30-minutes sitting meditation. To these classes Susan brings her years of experience with many different types of meditation including Vedic, Vipassana, Jewish and Buddhist studies. This light-hearted group is a perfect sangha (community) for those seeking a place to meditate and meet others along the path. All levels of meditators are welcome! Susan has been meditating for over 20 years and has been teaching for nearly seven years. Many people have been able to create a regular meditation practice by anchoring their week with this group meditation. The benefits of meditation include reducing stress, anxiety, and drama in your life, sleeping better, the ability to manifest desires more easily and to learn that true happiness comes from within! Wear comfortable clothing. Chairs and meditation cushions provided. You don't need to bring anything but yourself. If you can breathe, you can meditate! "We don't undertake meditation to become better meditators. We meditate to have a better life." Cost: $10 donation suggested. * Susan will lead meditation again in Hampden on the THIRD TUESDAY of the month. The first class will be on May 19, 6 pm - 7:15 pm) at 2050 Rockrose Avenue - the north end of the building;in the Itineris Building. Suggested donation is $10.
results.name: Breathe Ayurveda & Susan's Kitchen and Meditation on Main

results.description: This is the group of Apache NiFi users in the MD, DC, VA area. Apache NiFi is an easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data.  In late 2014 it was open sourced to the Apache Software Foundation and it graduated to a top level project in July 2015.  This meetup provides an opportunity to discuss Apache NiFi, where it is at, where it is going, and to help grow the community of both users and developers interested in the technology and problem domain.

Today, 40% of the world population has internet connectivity. In 1995, less than 1% of the world had internet connectivity. To support the IT infrastructure of the future, we will need bright, well versed cyber-security and networking gurus who have the passion and drive to continue in the never ending quest for knowledge and enlightenment; the individual who is excited about the technologies and how they work. Charm City Net Tech's goal is to bring together Technology enthusiasts alike in Baltimore into one space, engaging them in a series of labs, study sessions, as well as presentations. 

 We want to learn from each others experiences, and we want to cultivate learning along side each other. Meetup Members, feel free to reach out to me if you wish to speak about a certain topic! 


 Adam Bouhmad - Founder/Organizer
CCNA

There has always been only one story, the oldest...


In a northern Provence of the kingdom of Eldanath there has been an earthquake. Baron Arnel Vorn has sent riders north to the remote town of Northkeep to ascertain damage and the welfare of Northkeep's citizens. No word has returned. A troop of guardsmen followed and has also disappeared. What has befallen Northkeep and those sent to help? A group of adventurers is about to find out...

results.description: Imagine your overhead LED light could act as a wireless router and beam files and media to your computer. What if that same light could talk to appliances throughout your home? What if data transfer rates were up to 10Gbps? That scenario is no longer confined to the imagination: it's a reality! LiFi, or visible light communications (VLC), is a method of transmitting data using visible light, and viable prototypes mean this technology is on the cusp of hitting the mainstream. Get ahead of the curve and come learn about LiFi, its applications, strengths, weaknesses, and what it can do for you! Interested in learning more? Check out this TED talk by LiFi aficionado Harald Haas: http://www.ted.com/talks/harald_haas_wireless_data_from_e...
results.name: DC LiFi Innovators

results.description:
AAEW is a professional non-profit organization focused on empowering women to reach their fullest potential.  We do not just focus on professional development, AAEW believes that success lies in a thriving personal and professional life.  Through professional development, resources, personal support and collaboration, we empower women to confidently achieve their dreams and become leaders in their communities. 

We provide invaluable resources, guidance, accessible tools, and empowerment that will take women to the next level in their personal and professional lives.

Inspire : We bring together a high caliber of women who desire to share their knowledge, experience and support. to promote personal growth and positive connections.  Our goal is to inspire those who have a strong desire to move to the next level in their lives.

Growth: Through relationship building, collaboration and sharing, we promote growth and challenge that will build confidence and success.

Connections: We strive to bring together a strong force of women with big hearts, open minds and similarity so that an unbreakable link can be established.

American Association of Empowered Women, Inc.

www.aaoew.org

 

JOIN TODAY!

results.description: The 2015 Capital Fitness Festival will be held on Saturday, June 20th on the National Mall, right next to the Washington Monument and we hope that you will be able to join us to help promote a healthier lifestyle through sport and proper nutrition. Capital Fitness Festival is the first largest outdoor event of its kind held in the Nation’s Capital. The festival is a one-day event encompassing the three main areas of fitness – sport, health and wellness. We are bringing together the top fitness instructors in the DMV area, as well as the top nutritionists and businesses from within this industry to present their newest products and services. It will be a full day of workshops, demos, presentations and family fun oriented activities. Another difference that sets us apart from everyone else is that we will have a separate area for kids’ fitness activities.

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in creating an intentional sustainable homestead.  Its for people who value a healthy lifestyle, peace, low stress, harmony.  We can all work together cooperatively towards creating our homestead by growing food; including fruit trees, greens and other vegetables, herbs, berries, grapes, etc...  We can learn to live harmoniously together by implementing NVC (Non Violent Communication) and other effective and beneficial tools for communicating and relating in a healthy respectful way.  We can build our Eco structures on the land so there's no mortgage.  We can use compost toilets.  We can work from home to make incomes and live close to nature.  We can raise our children together so there's less overwhelm.  I started this meeting because I'm looking for other people to do this with .. To create community,, to support actualizing our ideas and visions
results.name: Sustainable Community Building

results.description: Sonja Secrets celebrates the opening of a new Holistic Healing Facility with a Meet and Greet Today, we all suffer from various conditions, be it stress or diabetes or heart-disease. We are moving too fast for our own good, and our bodies are paying for that. In the last few years, a new trend has emerged, that of holistic healing which uses a combination of various techniques to calm you down and to help you get rid of these diseases. Indeed, Holistic Healing has been proven to eradicate several diseases, which is why Maria is opening a new Holistic Healing facility. There are various sub-sects of holistic healing, and Maria Talton specializes in healing with chakras and special gemstones. Now what are chakras? Well, your body is a vessel of energy. Positive energy and negative energy, and sometimes this balance is upset due to certain life events. Now the concept of chakras is that there are different parts of your body corresponding to different kinds of negativity, and chakra healing basically revolves around these chakras, to act on the chakras that correspond to your problems. That's a very brief explanation, however, as there's a lot more to chakras. Now, when as for the gemstones, they have been used for centuries worldwide for treating ailments, for purifying oneself and for various other purposes. By placing gemstones in certain areas of the body for certain periods of time, you can rid yourself of ailments. Now Maria, after perfecting her holistic learning techniques has decided to commemorate the opening of her new facility, for which she is hosting a meet and greet where people can meet with the staff, schedule meetings, explore the facility, get knowledge on various holistic learning programs and much, much more. Any doubts that you have on holistic learning can be answered by Maria and by several other practitioners who will be present there. This meet and greet is taking place on the third of May from 12 noon to 5 in the evening at 14300 Gallant Fox Lane Suite 225 Bowie, Md. Those wishing to attend have to pay an entry fee of $25 per person, and as an appreciation of their visit, everyone will get a personal gift. Lite Fare will be provided. Those willing to know more can visit Maria's website, at sonjasecrets.com, or you can also contact her directly at 202-718-2753 .
results.name: Bowie Holistic, Meditation, Gemstones and Chakra Meetup

results.description: Hello, everyone! I am a student at the University of Maryland School of Social Work In Baltimore, MD. I get the sense there are a lot of neat people at UMB, but I never get the chance to run into them unless they go to the social work school and happen to be in my classes (well, the library, too, I guess, but I mostly just study there and then leave). So, i figured I would make a group for UMB students to serve as a social and proofessional networking group! It is open to current students, people who just got accepted to one of the schools and in enrolling, or recent alumni (by recent I mean people who graduated within 2-3 years). I wanted to make a fun social outing group that also allows for people to mingle and build up some professional connections- it's who you know, as they always say. I was thinking we could do anything from just grabbing lunch at one of the restaurants near the school, having study sessions at the library, going out to Fells or wherever for a fun night out, or anything anyone else would like to suggest! There is no age limit, everyone who meets the criteria I listed above is welcome to join! I do filter the group to make sure just that you are a student or recent alumni, but besides that, you'lll definitely be accepted into thte group. Thanks again, everyone!
results.name: UMB Student Meetup, Baltimore, MD

results.description: Currach racing on the Chesapeake Bay!  The Annapolis Irish Rowing Club is dedicated to promoting the nautical heritage of Ireland and the traditional Irish fishing and work boat, the currach.  We are a competivive rowing team, racing against other currach teams in the Northeast of the USA.  We are targeting athletic individuals who have a strong desire to compete and who are willing to make a commitment to practices and regattas. Irish currach rowing is a different technique and takes some practice to get the hang of it.  The Annapolis Irish Rowing Club is not crew-style rowing or Dragon-boat style rowing.  Our currachs are located on Spa Creek in beautiful downtown Annapolis.
results.name: Annapolis Irish Rowing Club (AIRC)

results.description:
NOTE:

• There is no charge to join this group.

• This group is not for travel agents.

• There will be no promoting services.

• Please contact admin for that,

• This group is based in MD.DMV area but we accept from all areas.

thank you


This group is for plus size women (but we welcome all who share the same passion) who are solo travelers ages 30 to 35 & over but hate traveling alone, sometimes.

We will indulge in weekend getaways, and traveling across the world-inexpensively, of course. We will only promote positivity.

Not only will we share the common goal of getting our passports stamped to capacity but we will also explore the opportunities to bond, make new friends, and network. Everyone is encouraged to give ideas for vacations, and events. all travel arrangements will be handled by group admin.

All members must

• attend a meet & greet within 3 months of joining

• have a photo in your profile.

•  be open minded, and ready to have fun


Please, no promoting services. Please always feel free to contact me via email with questions and concerns.

Cattiness, drama and ugly attitudes are not acceptable.
results.name: Divas with Passports

results.description:
Want to see great documentary films . . . followed by discussion . . . free of charge . . . every month? We believe this is the only documentary film series in Baltimore that is open to the public and free of charge. (We appreciate and encourage donations, but they're optional). 

We purchased a license from the Motion Picture Licensing Corporation.

Always on the fourth Wednesday of the month at 6:30 pm in downtown Baltimore. You can see the upcoming films here: http://http://baltimoreethicalsociety.org/programs-activities/film-series/

The current batch of upcoming films are all all academy award nominees - or winners.  After the viewing, we'll have a discussion, usually with a local expert or advocate on the particular topic to lead the discussion.

The series is hosted by the Baltimore Ethical Society in a beautiful viewing space, with free street parking.  Refreshments (beverages and snacks) are free, and other food is available for purchase. We'll take food orders (delivery pizza, etc?).  We can eat while we watch.  So bring a couple of bucks in case you get hungry.

We'll also use this site to announce a separate discussion series, without films, on Sunday mornings at 10:30 am in the same location. Also with food, and also free of charge.   These are presentations by local experts or advocates on a topicial issue, followed by Q & A.  These Sunday presentations are preceded by an introduction and brief announcements by the Baltimore Ethical Society, and followed by Q & A, then time to mingle, to enjoy snacks, and to speak with the presenter.
results.name: Charm City Film Series

results.description:
We are a group of Christian men and women who believe they have an end-time calling, and who are committed to being equipped, edified and empowered to fulfill it.  We are excited about walking in identity and authority as Ambassadors for Christ, preparing the Way of the Lord!  Christ is coming back for His Church - a Church without spot or wrinkle.  Therefore, The Bride must make Herself ready!  We have work to do!  The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.  The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few!  It's time to prepare the way of the Lord!

Who Should Join?  Men and women in ministry who ready to respond to the call of God on their lives. These are leaders in any capacity:  Sunday school teachers, ministry leaders, aspiring leaders, teachers, evangelists, altar workers, worship leaders, etc.  We are also giving special focus to those who serve full or part-time on staff at a Church or faith-based organization.  

Why Should You Join?

https://youtu.be/L8NX_ovuJVc


                      Our Mission is to raise up 1,000,000 Way Makers all over the world!  


Our study and discussion centers on the book entitled "The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ, Preparing the Way of the Lord" by Min. Angela M. Gracey, PHR. We meet bi-weekly on Saturdays from 10:00am to 12 noon, starting June 6, 2015, at the new Panera Bread, 14806 Baltimore Avenue in Laurel, MD. We are also committed to empowering, equipping and coaching aspiring authors to develop their creative gift and to give birth to the vision within them.   

This is what one of our pioneer leaders had to say:

https://youtu.be/0VrCrlmoZu4

We encourage all prospective members to come prepared to fully participate and commit to the process of growth and development as a Christian leader. If you are serious about the call of God on your life, we want to extend a warm invitation to join us! Jesus is coming back for a Church without spot or wrinkle. The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few! It's time to repent! The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. We are The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ! Preparing the Way of the Lord!
results.name: The Way Makers Book Club Meetup

results.description:
REAL WORLD LOCAL CONTENT TO HELP YOU GROW AS A REAL ESTATE INVESTOR IN VA, DC, & MD!

Over 1500 DC Metro Real Estate Investors and growing! Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups + training.

Monthly Format:

1) Introduction: 15 minutes
2) Training Q&A: 50 minutes
3) Deals/Networking/Fun: 30 minutes

Welcome to the largest real estate investment network in the DC Metro area. Each month we discuss a topic at length which will help you grow as a real estate investor.

Jan: Getting Started: Why Wholesaling Is Your Foundation & How To Do It Effectively

Feb: How To Market For Deals

Mar: How To Estimate Renovations

April: How To Negotiate The Deal

May: Where To Find The Money

July: Building Your Investment Dream Team

Sept: How To Manage Properties Effectively

Oct: Lease Options/Subject To:

Nov: Building Your Investor Partner/Private Money Team/Be the Bank

Dec: HOLIDAY PARTY - CAZA MVP Award

I look forward to seeing you all there, let's make it a great year!

PS: Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups & more training.

Join the #1 Real Estate Investment Group in Virginia, DC and Maryland.

results.description:
We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people.  Please join us!

Goodstitches is a national group with chapters opening all over the country. Check for ones in your area, on meetup.com. If there's not one yet then we are working on creating one.

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect.  By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches.  We will continue to work to get you good deals with everything you need.  Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

We look forward to meeting you in person and getting to know you!

The Goodstitches Team

For any questions, comments, ideas, advertising, or opening a group near you please contact:

Fena D'Ottavio

FenaBiz@gmail.com

results.description:
"Behind every successful woman should be a tribe of women who have her back."
Hello lovely ladies. Are you a single black woman in her mid to late thirties who has realized that everyone around you has kids and/or married and you feel left out? You often find yourself the only one at events with no kids and husband, maybe a boyfriend. It's fun chilling and spending time with our boyfriends, but every woman needs good girlfriends too. Men don't always want to do what we want to do. Do you often find yourself not having many girlfriends or female relatives to hang out with any more because they have relocated, gotten married, have mommy duties or have a certain time to be home. Do you sometimes find yourself sitting at home on a beautiful sunny day with no girlfriends to chill with. Or on a weekend night watching Lifetime, LMN or Bravo? Do you just want to be spontaneous sometimes and just call and say let's go out or do something fun? This group is for heterosexual, Christian,  professional, classy, intelligent, positive and drama-free and like-minded women that are seeking to socialize and build true lasting friendships that will develop into a sisterhood. This will be a small group to foster a close knit and engaging atmosphere. The group will consist of women that are supportive, encouraging, inspirational and uplifting to one another. Let's engage in some awesome activities, while developing bonds and making memories that will last a lifetime. Some of the activities include: dining, brunch, lounges, cruises, festivals, concerts, plays, broadway musicals, live bands, weekend getaways, movies, spas, picnics and day trips. Having children or getting married doesn't define you, they enhance your life. We never know what God has in store for us. Until then, let's live our lives and enjoy us until we do get married and become moms. If you are interested in meeting other wonderful, like-minded ladies to explore the DMV and so much more, please join this group. I understand that sometimes you won't be able to attend every outing, but please be an active participant to make this group a success. This is not just a meetup but friendship group. Constant no shows will lead to the member being deleted from the group. Currently this group is closed to new members.
results.name: Laurel Sisterhood Meetup Ages 30-40 (Without Kids)

results.description:
We are a social running group that welcomes people of all paces. 

While Baltimore is known for its rats that scurry underneath, we scurry over Roads And Trails --we are the Baltimore RAT Runners. 

Our Monday runs start at 6:45 p.m. next to the Under Armour store on S. President St. (we are not associated with UA). We have options for 3-6 miles depending on your level. 

Also, if you drive and find parking difficult, try the 1200 block of Bank Street for free street parking.  Also, the Little Italy Garage is inexpensive and safe.  It's between Central, Exeter, and Bank streets.

 Whether you live in Baltimore or are visiting, feel free to join us. 

Dan
results.name: Baltimore RAT Runners

results.description:
This is a meetup group that is focus on informing and supporting its community members on variety of sensitive  topics relating to Maryland Medical Marijuana Commission's regulatory updates and mandates as it pertains to the new Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's  initiative. 

Green Pro partners and Wellness, along with its team of meetup organizers plan to facilitate and engage this group with series of monthly community Meetups and Webinar events  in downtown Civic Center as well as other strategic business locations within the community, along with special guest and subject matter experts on specific topics.     

• May 2015 event is for those interested in "The Medicinal Marijuana Business in      Maryland." There will be an expert panel and business organizations on hand to answer questions and a chance to make connections vital to a successful business.  Follow this link to RSVP  for this event. 

• June 2015 event is for those members interested in "Networking event." Guest will include potential growers, dispensary owners, strain specialist, and industry equipment suppliers. Exact date and time to be announced.

• July 2015 event is for those interested in knowing “Different ways to administer.” Guest and topics will include Edible vendors, “Cannabis pairing advice”, uses of oils, vapor, and topical's. Exact date and time to be announced.

• August 2015 event is for those interested in "Understanding the application process." Special guest (TBA)

Blue skies and Warm waters

We use the Prepare - Enrich marriage profile to help us take an honest look at our relationships and build strategies for growth and improvement. Benefits include:

results.description:
Calling and Recruiting the people of God who are not afraid or ashamed to spread the Love of God by publicly displaying examples, images, models, and teachings that reflect The Word of God and the Gospel of Jesus Christ to other believers and non-believers in transit of their typical days routine. Whether your a skateboarder, a therapist, a DIY enthusiasts, a sign flipper, a bi-lingual translator, or a first lady, let's commit to honoring the Kingdom and God's word by intentional servanthood to others in the world. Sure, we have differences and we may not see "eye to eye" but, if we can accept one another "as is", we have already won the first battle of conformity and tradition. Let's agree to meet in order to walk/work together for the purpose of accomplishing God's Will.  To create revolving strategies by translating the Living Word of God into creative action and imagery, it is very important to "Tell us about yourself". Please communicate your talents, gifts, skills, knowledge, personality, etc., that will best project your God given abilities and capacity to show God's love to others.  To display these "Actions/Acts" of God's Love to others in the general public, we aim to meetup once a month to actually do the hands on work, which will be the result of putting some presentations in rotation and developing a good flow among members. Occasionally, expect an extra meetup to strategize new actions afforded to us by the Holy Spirit, the needs of the people, and communities we serve. Even in our common interaction, as a group, in public we can represent The Love of God by also engaging in discipleship, fellowship, and showing others that Christians are fun, loving, and creative outside of our spiritual comfort zones and associates. We welcome all Believers in God and His Word, who have a heart for God, and who want to serve people with their talents, time, and resources. God's will be done!

Disclosure: The meeting locations are tentative and up for discussion depending on the members who join.  The group is designed to be a mobile christian based street outreach that combines discipleship and team-building in the body of Christ, To enable us to be laborers in the harvest (plant, plow, sow, seed, water, etc.,) and pour out the name of Jesus in the our streets and other public platforms.

results.description:
Welcome to the Baltimore chapter of The Nonfiction Authors Association, a national organization featuring a vibrant and supportive community for trailblazing writers. Our members include experienced and aspiring authors of business, self-development, health, reference, memoir and other nonfiction books.

Our NFAA local chapters focus on the business side of writing, publishing and promoting nonfiction books. Meeting agendas include a guest speaker focused on a topic related to the publishing industry, introductions by all attendees, and a signature mastermind session where three to five attendees are selected to share a publishing-related challenge or question and receive feedback from the group (a wildly popular feature of our meetings!).

First-time visitors to an NFAA local chapter are not required to be members of the Nonfiction Authors Association, however, if you’d like to return to a second meeting and beyond, we do require that you join us online with either a Basic membership (free) or Authority membership ($19/month). Authority members receive many added benefits including:

·  Access to recordings from our twice-monthly teleseminars with industry professionals

·  Weekly marketing tips sent via email.

·  Special discounts with our sponsor partners, including a substantial discount off access to Profnet, a PRNewsWire service that connects authors with media interviews.

·  Special discounts off our annual Nonfiction Writers Conference and year-round Nonfiction Book Awards.

·  Local chapter benefits include priority in our popular Author Mastermind portion of the meetings, a members-only magnetic name badge to wear to meetings (after three months of Authority membership), and periodic event discounts during the year.

***For additional information and to join the Nonfiction Authors Association, visit:
http://nonfictionauthorsassociation.com/join/. ***

No matter where you are on your publishing journey, whether you’re just getting started or you’ve already authored dozens of books, whether you’re self-published or traditionally published, we welcome you and hope you will join us for our lively and informative meetings!

NOTE: If you represent an organization or group that is in need of a speaker, please browse our member directory or contact our group leader for a personal recommendation.
results.name: Baltimore Chapter - Nonfiction Authors Association

results.description:
The meetup group is Tom Thumb Square Dance Club and it is for those who want to socialize and exercise at the same time, make new friends and just have fun!!!!! There is a slogan we dancers use: While dancing in a square you make a circle of friends! Dancers must be at least 18 years of age, couples, singles and families are welcome to attend square dance lessons hosted by the club and children are allowed if accompanied by an adult.  Lessons usually start in early September (14th of September) and are held at the Catonsville Senior Center. Beginner dances are held every 6-8 weeks during the time a new dancers is learning to dance. For information call 301-919-2525 or e-mail your request to roslyn.powers@gmail.com. Square Dancing is lead by a caller and all in the square work together to dance to the caller's choreography. Square dancing is a team sport and once you learn the calls you can dance anywhere, USP, Europe, China, et cetera. Square Dance Calls are a universal language.


The club dances every first and third Friday of the month. We dance at the Hollifield Station Elementary  School in Ellicott City, MD.


Come watch us dance!!  We will be hosting a square dance demo at the Howard County Fair. Demo is at 5pm at the Entertainment Stage on Saturday, August 8th and a beginner's dance is at 7pm in the 4H Activities Hall.
results.name: Tom Thumb Square Dance Club- Ellicott City, MD

topics.name: Quality of Life for the Elderly

results.description:
If you have ANY health issues and want to see if you can get better naturally, check this out!

Back/neck pain?  Knee/hip pain?  Digestive problems?  Weak muscle tone?  Scoliosis?   

Our physical body can maintain, regenerate and heal itself. Proper walking awakens the body’s natural healing functions so it can operate with optimal efficiency and greater synergy. 

Whereas eating properly not only fills us up, but also nourishes our body with essential vitamins and nutrients, walking not only gets us from point A to point B, it also naturally and properly helps to adjust our muscles, spine, bones and joints, and energy pathways. 

Proper natural walking also helps our emotional health, mind, and spiritual heart.

Natural-Walking is easy and gentle.  

Once you learn how to walk by this method, continuing to walk 30 minutes a day usually results in improvements in various health issues.
results.name: Secrets of Natural Walking in Columbia, MD

results.description:
Fabulous Traveling Girlfriends, is and AWESOME Travel Group for women in their 20's, 30's and 40's and plans age specific trips for our Fabulously Over Fifty Traveling Girlfriends. We provide women Nationwide the perfect opportunity to experience the world with supportive, like-minded women who have been bitten by the travel bug. 

We are real women, serious about travel. YOU should be too.

We don't collect Meetup groups. We collect Friendships....Memories....Passport Stamps!

If you are a "Down to Earth", Independent Traveler able to go with the flow, enjoys Culture, Food, Wine (Spirits), Nature and Music, then you'll fit in just fine.

Fabulous Traveling Girlfriends is dedicated to vibrant women, ages 25 and older living EVERYWHERE; wanting to explore the world with an intimate group of girl-friends and travel companions. Our curious, fun and carefree members share the desire to live life better by exploring Southern California and the world beyond. We'll have a variety of local events for everyone to enjoy & get to know each other.


*If you've been dreaming of going on an African Safari, join us for our annual trip!

*Certified Francophiles here! We LOVE Paris, the City of Lights, the City of Soul.

*We've got the BEST connections in Cuba - and take bi-annual trips!

*Whether you are a novice or experienced traveler, this is the group for you!
*If you are a fun and adventurous Pathfinder, then this is the group for you!
*If you are a lover of Art, Food, Wine, History & Culture, join us.
*If your thing is to see ALL of the major tourist attractions, join us.
*If you are single, or a solo traveler looking for a travel buddy, join us.
*If you are an adrenaline junkie, searching for a little adventurous, join us.
*Enjoy bird-watching, hiking or walking while you travel? There's lots of that. *If you aim to travel off the beaten path, we'll plan trips where we are fully immersed in the culture, meet the locals, eat authentic regional cuisine & live the actual local experience.

results.description:
Welcome to the Gampopa Center in Annapolis! We are a community of Buddhist students and practitioners located in Eastport. Our center is located at 424 Fourth Street in Annapolis. We gather six times a week to study and practice: we recite traditional chants, practice various meditation techniques, discuss traditional texts, and more. Please take a look at our ongoing calendar for upcoming meetups.

ABOUT THE CENTER

The Gampopa Center was founded in 2009 in Annapolis, Maryland, by Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche based on the Buddhist understanding that the teachings of Buddha can bring us peace, happiness, and freedom. Lama’s students were excited to welcome a qualified Tibetan Buddhist teacher into the community and wanted to provide a place for learning and practicing Dharma. 

As a growing community of lay Dharma practitioners, we are grounded in but not limited to the Karma Kagyü lineage. The Center consists of a small shrine room, and we are actively looking to enlarge our facility.

ABOUT OUR MAIN TEACHER

Our community is grateful for the opportunity to learn and practice under the direction of an authentic, accomplished guide, Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche. 

Born in Tibet in 1973, he is a monk, scholar, and author. The Dalai Lama and the Seventeenth Gyalwang Karmapa have glowingly endorsed his book The Lamp of Reasoning and Scriptures of the Sage, the Buddha. 

He has completed a traditional three-year retreat under the guidance of the Very Venerable Bokar Rinpoche, who subsequently appointed Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche to be a three-year-retreat teacher. He has received advanced Buddhist training from masters in India, Sikkim, and Nepal. Now a citizen of the United States, Lama Phurbu Tashi Rinpoche makes his home in Annapolis, Maryland.

______________________________________

The Gampopa Center has an open door policy. Friends and members are welcome to come and go as you wish. While we do not charge for most sessions, you are welcome to make a donation if you are so moved.
results.name: Gampopa Center Meetup (Annapolis)

results.description: MMA reflects a group of professional and focused women who support, encourage and hold one another accountable in leveraging their talents and unique gifts to build wealth, impact their communities, and be world changers! We offer a protected, intimate networking environment – a time and place to be vulnerable and to be “OK” with not knowing what we do not know, yet exchanging knowledge, ideas and contacts, so that we all are empowered to walk away from each exchange knowing just a little bit more than before we came, and sowing that back into one another, our businesses, our careers, our families and our communities.

results.description:
A community of people in the DC metro area who are some flavor of polyamorous/ethically nonmonogamous who are also trying to raise tiny humans (or very much want to!) into functional, awesome adults amidst it all, and also maybe do other stuff in their lives. Join us for conversations online and off, potlucks, game nights, serious discussions, playdates, and who knows what else.

This group is geared toward people with experience in nonmonogamous relationships, who either also have children or are interested in having children. The scope of this group is to specifically connect about the intersection of parenting and people with multiple partners. 

To create a safe space for our members to freely meet and connect and express themslves, we ask that everyone agree to honor confidentiality, and act with honesty and respect. The identity of members and what is shared online or at events is to remain confidential. At events and online please be honest with and respectful of other members. 

This group welcomes people of all sexual and relationship orientations and identities, religious affiliations, spiritual beliefs, races and ethnic backgrounds, physical appearances and abilities, ages or other personal particulars.

Note: Some folks are concerned about confidentiality. No one can see that you've joined this group unless they are a member. For maximum privacy, you should also make certain you change your account settings so as not to display your Meetup memberships. All members must be approved by the group administrator before joining.
results.name: DC Polyamorous/Ethically Nonmonogamous Parents

results.description:
For any woman who has went through the guilt and shame of abortion, let's get together in a strictly non-judgmental setting and talk about it our experiences.  I believe accountability and reliability to and in each other as friends and sisters in our journey will help us heal. I believe in the power of the testimony (our own true story) and we will also use this as an opportunity to help hurting women who may be faced with the same decision presently or gave into abortion in the past. 

I am a practicing Christian. Although I am so, this group is open to any woman of any race, culture, or faith as long as and individual doesn't act in a unmannerly manner towards another. Expect to be built up, encouraged, to learn to heal and forgive ourselves and others about the decisions we made. Let's dry our silent tears and live a full life, realizing our decisions of the past don't define who we really are. 

Outside of community service, we will have many opportunities to fellowship and go on outings and day/weekend trips. Look forward to an atmosphere of freedom, release, and joy. Join us.
results.name: The Whole Woman of Baltimore

results.description: Zahara Cosmetics is a beauty line for the modern women designed to help women enhance their natural beauty. We will be hosting various events to showcase our products, meet all makeup lovers, empower one another, and most importantly have fun! Follow us on Instagram at zaharacosmetics Follow us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ZaharaCosmetics Follow us on Twitter at Zaharaglam Follow us on Pinterest at Zahara Cosmetics Official Website: www.zaharacosmetics.com
results.name: Makeup Lovers Unite: Be Your Own Beauty

results.description: How does going out on 30 dates in 30 days sound?...crazy right! I'm creating a group for the people that want to speed up the process of dating without going on long drawn out dates or breaking the bank. In this group we have one major rule...<br>Your first date can only last 30 minutes long, after that, it's up to the both of you to decide if you want to meet again.
results.name: 30 dates in 30 days- singles meetup

results.description: This group is for women of all ages who are child-free by choice or circumstance, educated but laid back, and who want to meet up and do a variety of fun things the area has to offer with other like-minded and child-free women. Winery tours? Let's go! Monthly Book club? Absolutely! Sporting or music events? Yes! Foodie events? Oh, yes! Day trips? possible! There is so much to do in our area! Let's make this group of child-free women amazing, ladies!

results.description: This is an open invitation to any women who would like to practice their English conversation skills. It will be informal, but we will have materials to assist with conversation. This is hosted by native English speakers, who have a background in Portuguese and Spanish,  but all are welcome!! We will meet a weeknight at Belmont park  in the Perry Hall or in a perry hall home. If your wish to bring children just let is know! The park has a playground.
results.name: Ladies' Tea, Coffee and English Corner

results.description:
This is a group for people who want to have a pleasant walk or hike. There are three rules: 1) We walk at a moderate pace, slow enough to see the scenery and to chat but not so slow we are not getting exercise and keeping a good pace. 2) We leave no one behind. 3) We stop as a whole group, every so often, to catch our breath. We will not have a group of fast walkers stop and rest and as soon as the slow walkers catch up, they take off, leaving the slower group never catching a break! 

Please let us know if you are coming on a walk/hike, but if you can't make it, don't worry about saying that you are not coming! If you change your mind, change your RSVP.


Looking forward to a great group of folks to walk/hike with! 


Pat
results.name: Maryland Relaxed Walkers and Hikers

results.description: If you'd like for your child to have some play time with other kids this is the group for you. Parents and kids make friends. All ages welcome!

results.description: Calling all softball players! I'd love for more people to get involved in this awesome sport in my awesome city! Also we can discuss facilities, rules, and new ideas. Im also super pumped about socializing with some fellow Softball players around our great city! Softball is the perfect mix of healthy competition and laid back attitudes, so lets do this!!!

results.description:
Every entrepreneur needs technology these days. Dev Talks is part of LAUNCH! Annapolis' mission to build a tech community for entrepreneurs in Annapolis. The meetup will host talks and discussions to introduce the latest technologies in a practical way to help you build your business.

results.description: If you like tennis for all of its friendly social benefits, than this is the group for you. We organize tennis players gatherings centered around fun, food, drinks, and positive people. results.name: DCBA DangerousCurves Organization events of Maryland

results.description:
For Parents of Toddlers and Infants to have a safe and easy way to meet others and attend public playdates. Outings will mostly be at parks but may include occasional events at the train museum, the aquarium etc. This is ideal for parents in the Ellicott City area but if you can make it to events it doesnt matter where you are coming from. We currently have most of our events on Mondays and Wednesdays in the morning.

How we work:

Moms, Dads, Caretakers, Nannies and Grandparents are welcome. 

For everyones safety we require a profile picture with a clear shot of your face  

No marketing products/belief systems/work opportunities etc. This is not a place to sell or scheme and offenders will be removed.


Our group will not exceed 50 members at any time.  Members who are not active, subject to the discretion of the Organizer, will be removed from the group.

results.description: The Baltimore Weed Warriors Program, under the TreeBaltimore Program, is the citywide initiative to control invasive species. Take our classes and become a certified Weed Warrior and get your card, tshirt, and books! Participate in an invasive removal event! Request a Road Show! Or all three!
results.name: Baltimore Weed Warriors

results.description: Fathers are one of Earth's greatest treasures. Lead by example so your child becomes the example. Our group hosts an array of Social Workouts from mountain bike riding to running. We focus on nutritional eating and fitness activities where each Fit Father can learn from one another while burning calories. Stay active, eat clean and energize your life!
results.name: Fit Fathers

results.description:
Are you a small business owner looking to get your business online? Do you have a website? If so, does your website have analytics so you can evaluate your traffic and optimize for new customers or clients? Do you have social media set up to interact with your customers? If not, it's time to get into the game! Let's meetup and iron these things out... changes are, you're going to profit from this time.

I meet many small business owners that are looking for support, and hiring a professional would cost $250/hour easily. If we can get together, share from our experiences of what we did that worked, and what didn't work, and where we are stuck someone else may have overcome.

This is an open source place for information sharing fro small business owners, or anyone looking to launch their online presence.

The knowledge you will gain from this group is well worth more than the dues. Installing google analytics on your website is easily a $250 task. With this group, you get a whole month of support in a community to network with as you go along.
results.name: MD Online Marketing Meetup

results.description:
The Columbia Emi (Breath of Life) Circle meets monthly for Breathology Mini "Retreats". The first retreat unofficially launched on JUNE 27. 

WELCOME!


https://youtu.be/8urbmAgo6vg

https://youtu.be/8urbmAgo6vg

Learn to assess and improve your breath mechanics.  Overcome/manage anxiety, depression, stiffness, aches and pains and improve well being. Each meetup has a different "flavor" based on who is present. Prepare for things to organically flow.  I am asking participants to complete our Breathology™ Survey at the end of sessions to help me improve and spread the word effectively. This is 100% confidential and voluntary. 

Meetups will be at a sacred and scenic outdoor location such as Bon Secour Labyrinth, The Shrine  of St. Anthony in Ellicott City, MD, or other outdoor locations we find inspirting. Please check EACH meetup to make sure you go to the right place. No photos are allowed (unless approved by everyone present 100%) as our participants consider this retreat sacred and deeply personal.

Each mini-retreat is designed to be an informal leisure mini getaways for ALL AGES - children are encouraged to attend with parental or guardians. Breathology is for everyone. Bring a blanket or mat for the ground if you choose.

PURPOSE OF MEETUP

Learn what is breathology?

Why learn correct breathing mechanics?

Get a breath assessment?

Get a breath mechanics correction?

Practice deep breathing for overall wellness, disease prevention, detoxifying and more!

BENEFITS:

Promotes relaxation and relieves stress
Corrects inefficient or abnormal breathing patterns
Improves overall endurance
Improve function during daily activities
Improve oxygenation (intake of oxygen)
Retrain the muscles for respiration
Improve ventilation
Lessen the "work" or effort of breathing
Improves gaseous exchange
Decreases respiratory rate (calms you down ;-)

Aids in bronchial hygiene (reduces accumulation of phlem)

Almost forgot another benefit - connect with Soul friends ;-)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

GROUP ETIQUETTE

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

• We require all members to have a clear picture of your face to join the group.  This protects all members. Contact me if you have a special situation which needs exemption.

• When you're unable to make an event you RSVP'd to, please be considerate of the people attending, waiting and/or hosting the event, and change your RSVP as soon as possible and at least 24 hours prior to the event.

• Be aware when you change our RSVP less than 24 hours of the event start or do not show up, this will be counted as a 'no show'.

• A minimum of 3 participants is required to host certain events as scheduled. Some may require more. Check the event for details. Please RSVP early to help us keep track of needs and help me to better communicate with you.

• Space will sometimes be limited. People who repeated "no shows", may be emailed a reminder and eventual may be asked to leave the group.

• Be courteous and respectful of the organizer and other members online, onsite and of course of their property. 

• Sharing is caring. Unsolicited advice is invasive. Boundaries are important in groups. This means refrain from providing advice to others unless they ask you for it. You can check before providing feedback. For example " may I offer you a suggestion". Please know the recipient is within their boundary rights to say No! They do not need to provide a reason. Use the "Four Agreements" do not take it personally :-)!

Irmina Tutu

SodoTutu

Join our blog: https://sparkoflifesunrise.wordpress.com/

Visit our website:  www.irminaulysse.com
results.name: Columbia Emi/Breath of Life Circle

results.description: The Roland Park chapter of BNI meets every Thursday morning at 7:30am at Miss Shirley's in Roland Park. Our mission is to become a sales and marketing force for each member in our chapter. We want to create strong personal relationships and trust within the group so with comfort, pass along quality referrals to each other and grow our businesses.

We will be having regular meetings/showcases/workshops.. one of which is known as AMPLIFY. Join us to give the DMV area a greater collective of creatives and professionals.
results.name: DMV Music Producers and Artists Meetup

results.description: Have you ever looked on OKCupid and filtered to matches who identify as Buddhists? I did, and I'm betting there are more single Buddhists in the area than that search turns up. Even if you don't practice, but are interested in meeting likeminded people, I hope this group will serve that purpose as well. So join the experiment, and let's find out how many of us are really out there.
results.name: Washington Buddhist Singles Meetup

results.description:
One in 10 Americans is living with a rare disease. You, person reading this, probably know someone with a rare disease, rare disorder, or rare syndrome or maybe you are one of the brave individuals living with one of these illnesses. 

This group is formed to build a community of those of us who "care about the rare" and drive awareness of our fundraising efforts. Shine Light on Rare Diseases is a fundraiser committed to raising $10,000 for National Organization for Rare Disorders (NORD) to support the National Institutes of Health's Undiagnosed Diseases Network. 

One of our fundraising avenues would be several events scheduled throughout 2015 such as happy hours, ice cream dates at Coldstone and Rita's stores, and a 5k Glow Run in the fall. There are several ways to take part and contribute to this cause so we look forward to your participation as we Shine Light on Rare Diseases together!

Donate: https://www.crowdrise.com/shinelightonrarediseases/fundraiser/nikkianarado/setup_success/member 

NORD is a 501c3 and all donations to NORD through the Crowdrise platform will be tax deductible.
results.name: Shine Light on Rare Diseases Fundraising Events

results.description: Baltimore County Nature Club offers a wide variety of activities to keep you active and involved with nature. From hikes, to canoe trips, plant walks, to birding, you'll find your niche with us. All classes and events are lead by a professional naturalist. We cater to kids, families, adults, home school students, scout groups, and more!
results.name: Baltimore County Nature Club

results.description: This is a group for those yogis who have spent periods of time at a Sivananda Ashram and who would like to gather for a monthly or bi-monthly satsang where we do the daily chants, potluck etc. I started going to the Ashram in the Bahamas in 2005 when I did my TTC . I have been back throughout the years and just returned from my last visit recently and am re-inspired to find and create a Sivananda community here! Washington DC NW.  Please share which Ashram or Center you have been connected to when you become a member on here.  Looking forward to growing a strong community with you all. Om Nama Shivaya!
results.name: Washington DC Sivananda Satsang Meetup

results.description: Looking for medium skilled tennis players to get together once a week and possibly one weekend depending on desire. Looking to start a group for fun and practice... Only requirement is that you are kind and don't take yourself or the game too serious.. Would like to have enough players so we can do round robins...
results.name: Columbia Fun Times Meetup Centennial Park for Tennis Medium

results.description:
Are you an older woman (40 and up) who wants adventure, wants to travel to other countries but doesn't want to go alone and doesn't want to spend a fortune joining a group (usually $300/day plus an added fee for not having someone to share a room with)? Do you not want to be on a tour bus going to tourist hotels and tourist restaurants? Older Women, Cheap Travel offer tours that cost one-third of what most companies charge and all of us women (10 per trip) share rooms which keeps the cost low. We also take local transportation (like "Chicken Buses" and Tuk-Tuks) and eat local food (in the market, on the street, in small restaurants). We see the sites but we also enjoy the culture by going where the locals go and not just to tourist venues. I, Pat Brown, will be your guide. Our upcoming trips are to Nicaragua from Jan 5-16, 2016, India in March of 2016 and Mexico in the fall of 2016. Find out more about the trips and how we travel at: 

http://www.olderwomencheaptravel.com

When we meet, we will enjoy international food at a variety of restaurants and we will talk about our experiences as women travelers and share tips and stories and our wish list of places to go. You may find yourself a travel partner, you may find great ideas to travel solo or hear about wonderful opportunities to join groups at a cheap price (like this great hiking group I joined in Guatemala; $20-$30/day for the hiking guide, lodging, and food and all the money earned went to charity!) Even if you never go on an Older Women, Cheap Travel trip, you are welcome to join our Meetup event and share travel ideas and experiences.

Even if you are not 20 or 30, you can still have a travel adventure and not go broke doing it. By the way, I am turning 60 next month and I still love to travel in a more adventurous way than being carted around in a "seniormobile"!
results.name: Older Women, Cheap Travel

results.description: Offering a monthly support group and network for patients and caregivers of Head and Neck Cancers. Each monthly meeting presents a professional caregiver delivering professional level information on a specific topic related to Head and Neck cancers. Additionally there are many survivors and current patients available to give first-hand insight as well as support during and after treatment. Come find a new friend! MEETINGS ARE THE SECOND WEDNESDAY OF THE MONTH.
results.name: SPOHNC (Support for Head and Neck Cancer)Baltimore, MD

results.description: This meetup group, coordinated through the Office of Cyber Development at the MD Department of Business & Economic Development, is designed to bring professionals from Maryland's Small Satellites and UAS (Drones) community together in an INFORMAL environment for SOCIALIZING and NETWORKING. Never an agenda. No fee to join/attend. Simply pay for whatever you order to eat and drink at the venue during the meetups. Meetups will be hosted at varying locations throughout the state. They're all about mixing and mingling and getting to know who's who in Maryland's Small Sat and UAS ecosystem. Join us for the fun. Feel free to invite others to attend. You never know who you'll meet and the business opportunities that may present themselves!
results.name: MD Small SAT & UAS Meetup

results.description: Have a cat on Instagram and want to get to know other Instagram cat owners in the area? Hoping to meet once a month for drinks or coffees, or dinner. Open to other suggestions as well. Let's meet and represent our cats, and share the love.
results.name: Cats of Instagram-Baltimore

results.description: If you enjoy biking, running, and swimming, and would like a fun workout that combines them, give us a TRI!  Everyone is welcome, but especially please join us if you are new to TRI workouts, over 50, and/or just looking for fun and fitness. (True for your friendly organizer on all counts.) Currently meeting in Columbia on M, W & F mornings, but open to other times and places you may propose and attend.

results.description: 67 Blankets for Nelson Mandela is a worldwide initiative to knit/crochet blankets for the less fortunate in our LOCAL community. Participants are invited to either make a blanket or contribute squares for us to join into blankets. We plan to distribute all blankets made to local charities in the Greater Baltimore Region after laying them around the Nelson Mandela statue in Washinton DC in July 2016. We need 670 blankets!! Let's meet up & knit/crochet and become 'Knitwits' for Madiba (Nelson Mandel's tribal name). Baby size 50x40, Twin 50x70 and single squares 10x10inches
results.name: 67 Blankets for Nelson Mandela - Baltimore

results.description: Have you wanted to learn about hypnosis and how it can help you but you have always been a little hesitant? This group is for those that want to improve themselves through the power of hypnosis. Whether it's weight loss, tobacco cessation, or modifying behavior, HYPNOSIS WORKS! The group is small and meets in a office space in Mount Vernon, light refreshments are served.
results.name: Baltimore Hypnosis Meetup at Scott Howard Coaching LLC

results.description:
This is the first Italian meetup group in Howard County! We focus heavily on learning Italian, appreciating Italian culture and we have members of all levels of proficiency from beginners to native speakers. Beginning speakers are very welcome but will need to self-study and also feel comfortable coming to groups where intermediate and native speakers will be talking quickly. In our small conversational groups members who attend will practice one on one with other beginner, intermediate and fluent speakers in a comfortable low-stress environment and the pairings will be switched regularly to keep the meetup moving along, provide the maximum amount of practice and opportunities to get to know more members. If you need more resources aside from Duo Lingo, don't hesitate to contact me.

If you're interested in Italian culture BUT you don't want to learn Italian or don't have the time right now then this isn't the group for you. Passatempo & Piazza Italia are two D.C. groups with thousands of members that have many fun events and you don't need to be a fluent speaker to attend them. There is also a Montgomery County group that will have a monthly event for beginning speakers starting in the fall.

Anyone is welcome to suggest new types of meetups and organize them. Since this is my first meetup group feedback is much appreciated. The events that we do regularly are 3-4 conversational groups per month, the monthly world language cafe at Wegmans, and pizzeria and restaurant nights out which are very popular! There is always room for more types of events like happy hours, a book club, and concerts, plays and carpooling down to some of the events in D.C. and Montgomery County. Spero di vedervi presto! I hope to see you soon!
results.name: Howard County Italian Speakers!

results.description:
The IIBA Baltimore Chapter (established in 2007) represents the IIBA throughout the Baltimore metropolitan area. The chapter provides ongoing professional development for business analysts who perform analysis for systems and business process improvement. Monthly chapter meetings provide interactive forum for BA practitioners to network and share best practices and industry trends. IIBA also provides a professional certification in the field of business analysis, based on collection of knowledge in the Business Analyst Body of Knowledge (BABOK). Our Chapter hosts events on the 2nd Tuesday of the month in the evenings near Baltimore to provide opportunities for networking, learning about best practices, and studying for certification.

For more information about our chapter, go to www.baltimoreiiba.org
results.name: IIBA Baltimore Chapter Business Analysis Meetup Group

results.description: If you love to sing, and you want more than just singing with the radio, come check us out. We are a fun loving, award winning group of women who meet in Harford County on Monday nights every week to hone our vocal skills, learn music and perform. We sing 4 part a cappella harmony in a variety of styles from barbershop to Beatles, ballads to beat boxing - okay not beat boxing--- yet. Don't worry if you don't read music, many of us don't, many of us do, so there's room for all skill levels. Bottom line, if you are looking to spend some time learning or re-learning what it is to be part of ensemble singing, this is the place for you... And we can't wait to meet you! Join us any Monday from 7-10 pm at St. Paul's Lutheran Church in Aberdeen, MD!
results.name: Upper Chesapeake Chorus

results.description: We will be a meetup group for Lesbians of Color 45+ that will form a collective sisterhood for women who are mature, professional, active, positive and fun. The group will enjoy museums/galleries, plays, music and dance concerts, outdoor festivals, hiking, biking, camping, state parks, beach, mountains, backyard cookouts, picnics, potluck dinners, film fests/independent cinema, drumming/instrument circles, dancing to house music and more. I have a conversion van that seats 7 people comfortably for day and overnight excursions. Look forward to meeting all new members. Peace. I would like the members to participate in the different activities if interested and not just a roster of names. PEACE.
results.name: Baltimore Lesbians of Color United Spirits 45+

results.description: Where in the world would you like to be? Dubai, Tahiti, Paris, Milan? This is a group for people who desire to see the world. We will meet at least twice a month to plan our dream destination escapes. We are a diverse group of people seeking like minded friends to share unique travel experiences. Join us, because traveling with friends makes travel memorable. Themed destination dinners, cultural conversations and group outings local and abroad will make this your favorite Meet Up!
results.name: Baltimore International Travel Group

results.description:
General Overview

We are group of tech enthusiast who would like to meet up and see how we can help Nepal's rebuilding effort using technology. The idea is to create technological solutions that can increase tourism in Nepal and also help generate revenue  for all involved parties such as tech companies, travel agents,marketing and ultimately to the vulnerable people of Nepal who have been devastated by recent earthquake of April and May 2015. Plan can be to seek interest in volunteerism and tourism and package programming to see the devastation and help rebuild it.

 What your Meetup Group is about

This group is about people who love adventures and find it worthwhile to step aside and help the needy people while still continuing their journey.  

This group is about people who believe that technology can  assist and foster communities in helping them rebuild themselves and rejuvenate .

Who should join: Describe your ideal members

If you are daring to take your next vacation in one of the most beautiful places in world such as foothill of world tallest mountain Mount Everest,birth place of Buddhism Lumbini, the world heritage site of Kathmandu, Patan Bhaktapur etc. Here is a quick google on places in and around Nepal.

Clink on the link below to see what you could be part of not just to see it but help it re-emerge from the devastation caused by recent earthquakes.

http://bit.ly/1Qy9lfa

While all of the natural beauty of the places remain same the people who live to serve the tourists have lost their homes and with this group we seek to gather people who are willing to visit these places and help the villagers re stand on their feet.

Why they should join: To learn, share, or have fun

Natural Calamities can be dangerous yet aftermath gives us a great opportunity to rebuild and redesign stuff on a clean slate. With thousand of schools destroyed and people living on temporary shelters, we have an opportunity to leave our mark on the community. Thus this group will see how can a day or two spent on trekking on these remote village can be used to rebuild the communities.  

If you believe that either a day of your  vacation is worth spending building a school or creating new tourism opportunity then you should join this group.

If you are into latest technological solutions such as real time data gathering, drone to promote areas,social media guru or a person who wants to meditate on tranquility of  wilderness with a breath talking mountain view then you should join this group.

What members can expect: Describe typical activities

Depending upon the mix of people, we will seek expertise and work on solutions to help increase tourism in Nepal. End goal being helping people of Nepal yet designing and devising solution package that works best for the travelers.

We can also work with local travel agents in and out of of USA/Nepal to design a complete packaged solutions to travel to one of these places from anywhere in the world and perform "Relief Tourism"

The technological service and solution that we design and develop will be universal hence look for opportunities to promote and market them outside of Nepal and shine as a next "Uber of the world "
results.name: Relief Tourism Nepal

results.description:
WHAT THE HECK IS "READY SET ACTION PROD"?

The name is a work in progress.... but basically it's a group in the D.C., Maryland, and Northern Virginia area where its members will collaborate to create YouTube movies for fun and to improve their skills in filmmaking.

Please go to the about section for more detail


WHAT KIND OF VIDEOS WILL WE MAKE?

I am going to focus on fictional work with actual acting rather than reality, documentaries, or "inspiration work." So yeah there won't be any "feel good" videos of filming people helping the poor or at a soup kitchen, sorry. Now a humorous parody of that, a badass soup kitchen action scene, or drama at the soup kitchen, probably.

It's really dependent on the talents that are hired and their interests. For instance, I am trained in martial arts and firearms so action shorts would feel natural for me though I would love to do more than that.

Oh and sorry to disappoint, but no pornos(unless they're like James Gunn's PG porn videos on YouTube) and no snuff films.


WHO AM I LOOKING FOR?

Who am I looking for to join this production/journey/quest? Talents. That includes actors, directors, fight choreographers, cinematographers, writers, etc(I laugh at those who only call the actors "talents"). Because I'm deliberately keeping group membership small and tight-knit, there's a chance many of us will be involved in multiple roles. In-depth answers to my membership questions will sway me more toward wanting you onboard. ONE WORD OR FEW WORDS ANSWERS WILL LEAD TO REJECTION.

Oh and if you're easily offended... probably not the best group to join. Generally, "PG-13" content is what we'll usually end up doing, but well I don't like to limit the creativity of this group. If you can handle South Park or a Quentin Tarantino film then you should be good to go.

results.description:
This is a group for singles over 55 looking to enjoy life. Our aim is form new friendships, engage in social activities and keep those gray cells active. This not a dating meetup group, so if that’s what you are  seeking – THIS IS NOT THE MEETUP GROUP FOR YOU!!

If you are a fun-loving, socially active, adventurous single person over 55 then join the group. Let's get together to enjoy plays, movie and dinner nights,  sightseeing trips, kayaking, day trips around the area, cookouts, concerts, biking and so much more. Let's project positivity - no drama.

Guidelines/Policies.

1.  Please read the entire meet up event narrative prior to asking questions. Too often the answer to the question can be found in the narrative.

2.When I post an event => ONLY YES RSVP'S NEEDED -- (I.E. DON'T RSVP "NO" UNLESS YOU ARE CHANGING A PREVIOUS RSVP OF "YES' - THANKS)

3. If a member is inactive within a 3 month period, they will be removed from the meet up group.

4. If you can't participate in a meetup event without constantly being on your cell - THEN DON'T PARTICIPATE - it's rude and unacceptable.

5. If you are unfamiliar with how to accomplish something on meetup, then please use the HELP function to get details on how to it.

6. Three consecutive missed events without RSVPing NO will result in removal from this meetup group.
results.name: 55 PLUS- SINGLE & ACTIVE BABYBOOMERS

results.description:
Hi friends,
I am one of the volunteers of Isha foundation. This is a charitable organisation founded by Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev.
He is a yogi and mystic and has designed various programmes for inner wellbeing.
It is Sadhguru's vision to make one drop of the profound technology of Yoga available to every human being. As part of celebrations for International Day of Yoga on 21st June, He has opened up the possibility of “Upa Yoga” to be offered to the world. 
“Upa Yoga can be taught and practised anywhere and the benefits are quite immense. It does not demand the same commitment as yoga nor does it cause any problem if you do it improperly because you can’t do it improperly – it’s very simple, and it is a stepping stone"

– Sadhguru

We are offering a variety of Upa Yoga practices for free on21 June, 2015
6 tools are available, each for a specific dimension of your life – Health, Joy, Peace, Love, Success and Inner Exploration. 

Learn online | Find a workshop
Isha Foundation has been a leader in offering scientifically structured solutions for individuals to live as conscious, joyful and healthy human beings. 

For more information And free registeration go to sadhguruinlondon.com
Benefits of yoga practices offered,

Enhances vitality, focus, memory and productivity 
Stabilizes the body, mind and emotions
	Strengthens and stabilizes the spine 
Can relieve back pain, stress, anxiety and tension	
	Can relieve from chronic ailments and improves overall health
	Enhances teamwork and communication
	Imparts a lasting sense of joy, peace and fulfillment
Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‘s 50 most influential people, his life and work has deeply touched the lives of millions worldwide. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds, and acts as a bridge to the deeper dimensions of life. 

Sadhguru established Isha Foundation, a non-profit organization supported by over three million volunteers worldwide. Through powerful yoga programs and large-scale humanitarian projects, Isha Foundation has created a massive movement dedicated to address all aspects of human wellbeing, without ascribing to any particular ideology or belief system. 


isha.sadhguru.org

Copyright © 2015 Isha Foundation
www.ishafoundation.org | Contact us | Privacy | Unsubscribe
15, Govindasamy Naidu Layout, Singanallur,Coimbatore - 641 005, INDIA.

results.name: Torture & Terror:  Watch &  Discuss - Taxi to the Dark Side

results.description:
If you are from the south and new to Maryland or just miss your southern roots and long to be back where you don't feel tempted at any point to apologize for being a conservative Christian, this could be a perfect group for you. My husband and I have a young toddler and about to have our second child and are more and more feeling isolated in this state, because our views are so different than many of our friends and the community.  It's not that we talk politics with others, but as they share their opinions on their own or we watch the news, we see just how different we are and feel a bit out of place.  We often hear things and will ask each other, "are we the only ones here who think that is totally insane??"  

Our culture has accepted two huge lies. The first is that if you disagree with someone’s lifestyle, you must fear or hate them. The second is that to love someone means you agree with everything they believe or do. Both are nonsense. You don’t have to compromise convictions to be compassionate.- Rick Warren. I totally agree with him.

We would love to expand our group of friends to include some conservatives. I also miss the south so much and would love to make a few southern friends up here. 

For those interested who stay at home, we could plan a weekly or monthly bible study and let the kids play, plan play dates elsewhere, craft nights, my husband loves golf and real estate, we would be up for planning family cookouts, football games, holiday parties, ect.  I'm open to anything with this group.  Just curious to see who is out there!
results.name: Moms Raised in the South
